I have been using lipogaine for over a year now and I am very satisfied. I also take finasteride / propecia, along with hair vitamins with my lipogaine. I believe using all three of these things in combination help me keep my hair. For the price of lipogaine you should at least give it a try because if you don't you're going to lose your hair anyway. That's when I came across Lipogaine saw that it had a bunch of good reveiws and the price wasen't at all bad. After 6 month I did notice that the crown area where my hair was thinning was starting to close in. It's safe for me to say that this product does indeed work you just need to give it some time. Buy it apply it regularly and you'll soon see the results you would exspect from this product.

  11. Lipogaine has significantly slowed further hair loss for over two years now, when regular minoxidil did absolutely nothing for me. It also stops scalp itch that was horrible when I wasn't using the product and that resumes if I miss a day for whatever reason.<br /><br />While it didn't reverse my hair loss and hasn't stopped it completely, I do wish I started using it sooner, and would recommend trying it at the first sign of a problem. I lied to myself for two years after I first noticed a receding hairline before trying anything, and it's time I can't get back now.<br /><br />For me, the hair loss sucks, but the scalp itch had a profound impact on my everyday activities.   12. About a year ago have noticed thinning/receding on the temples and front hair line. Did some research and decided to go with this product and been using it ever since. It's been maintaining and recently I have noticed some growth (on my hair line where i have been applying it). I see some reviews where people except some kind of miracle to happen. You gotta be realistic, your hair is not going to grow over night and in most cases you will never have the hair you had when you were a teenager. But a product like this one can certainly help, and if you can at least maintain it i would say its being successful. I also have read you can use this with a combination of an oral drug (finasteride) for maximum results, i might look into that once this starts to lose effectiveness. Ohh and the year i have been using this product i haven't experienced or noticed any side effects. i use it twice a day once in the morning and once in the evening as directed.<br /><br />Good luck to everyone
  13. I started using regular minoxidil about 20 years ago and it stopped (or at least slowed way down) the thinning of my hair. About 3 years ago the minoxidil seemed to start losing it's effectiveness and I started losing the battle of the balding again. At this time I decided to add Lipogaine to my regimen and after a month or two I noticed that the thinning once more stopped and I started to see regrowth again. This has been true now for these three years. What I have been doing to save some money is use .25 mL for each the front, middle and back of the top of my head and then use about .25 - .50 mL of generic inexpensive minoxidil over all my head again to compliment the Lipogaine. This stretches the Lipogaine out for much longer than a month. If money is not an issue then I would recommend using more Lipogaine on the areas you are concerned about. Lipogaine also has more consistency and does not run as much as regular minoxidil. I can put Lipogaine on and wait a few minutes and comb my hair and can hardly tell I put anything on. One more tip for some who need or will need it: as long as you can keep some type of hair on thinning areas of your head that is all products like Caboki need in which to cling to and give you an illusion of a nice head of hair.
  14. I've used this product for over a year now. I'm in my early twenties and started noticing some slight thinning on my hair line. I began using the product to try and limit the amount of recession. Since I started using it, i haven't noticed any increased thinning. I have some slight hair regrowth around my temples and few hairs have grown around the middle of my hairline. I use the product regularly after I shower and before I go to bed.<br /><br />I would caution those who are just starting out to not expect results immediately. You may also see more hair falling out, which is normal when you first start using this product.

I massage the product into my scalp with my fingertips after applying.

  21. I don't know that it's helping me regrow my hair, but it's certainly slowing the loss process, and I appreciate that immensely.
  22. The Lipogaine Intensive Treatment is a very high-quality Minoxidil (5%) product. In addition to Minoxidil, it has several other ingredients that help block the effects of DHT and stimulate hair growth: Saw Palmetto, Biotin, and DHT blocker proprietary blend. Previously, I had used Rogaine foam for two years. I found that the Rogaine foam makes the hair very sticky and flat. The Lipogaine product uses a dropper to get the product directly on the scalp as opposed to on the hair where it cannot be absorbed. The product dries within 10 minutes and will not leave the hair flat. You can style your hair as needed once the product is dry.<br /><br />I have only used the product for 2.5 months so I can't say for sure if new hair will grow as a result of continual use. I can say that the product will at least slow and maybe stop further hair loss. In order to see the full effect, the product must be used continuously for 6 months. I plan to continue this product at least until that time frame. So far, it is the best Minoxidil product I have tried.

I look like my old self again. It will take a few years to bring this solution to the market.<br /><br />(2) In December 2010, scientists at the Berlin Technical University in Germany revealed they had grown the world's first artificial hair follicles from stem cells. Research leader Dr. Roland Lauster said within five years millions of hair-loss sufferers could grow new hair from their own stem cells and have it implanted into their bald spots.<br /><br />So if you have rash from hair growth solution like me, there is hope on the horizon.

  42. I've been using this product with Regenpure Kit for a year. I noticed that the first 2 months didn't make much of difference. So I am taking a 2 months break hoping it would give my body a chance to reset.
  43. This product is far more efficacious than generic minoxidil or even Rogaine. I used the latter two products since turning 21, over the course of 5 years. They worked well enough for a while, but then I noticed my shedding accelerating. At first I added propecia to my routine, but I began noticing side effects almost immediately. I discontinued that and sought a product that included topical DHT blockers. I found both my minoxidil AND DHT solution in Lipogaine. After about 2 months of use, I noticed far less shedding and thicker, fuller hair - including in the temple regions.<br />I use this product along with their Big 3 shampoo and Nioxin's normal to thin hair shampoo (alternating every other day). As the instructions suggest, I am conscious to apply the solution twice a day, and I do not wash my hair afterward. While tempting, it is far better to avoid washing your hair twice in the morning, as that will cause follicle damage and your hair to increasingly appear thinner, as well as prevent the full absorption of the Lipogaine solution into your scalp. You'll find that it's less greasy than generic minoxidil, anyway.<br /><br />Overall, by using the above routine I am happy to say my hair is looking much better than it did 3-4 years ago.
  44. I've been using Lipogaine for a year now. It seems to have slowed hair loss, but hair loss/receding of front hair line is still occurring. However, hair loss does seem to have slowed, which is good...but I was hoping for much more. I'm scared to get off of it, because I don't want to lose what I've helped to slow. I give the product a 3 of 5.

I can't say that I have seen lots of regrowth, however. One drawback is that this product takes a long time to dry. A faster drying product that leaves behind little to no residue would be a godsend, and I'd likely be able to adhere to two applications per day more regularly. But with my schedule, 1 per day is already difficult enough. With that said, I will continue to use the product and hope that the rate of loss is slow enough to give me a couple more good hair-filled years.

  49. This review is in response to an offer from Lipogaine for three free bottles, but what I say here isn't slanted by that.<br /><br />For several years I used Minoxidil (generic Rogaine), which did indeed provide hair growth on the crown of my head. Eventually, though, I was only maintaining past progress.<br /><br />Switching to Lipogaine has produced further hair growth on both crown and temples. I apply it only once a day, in the morning. To verify, last summer I went back to straight Minoxidil and soon noticed the tide slowly going out again, confirming that (at least on on my head) Lipogaine's additional ingredients do make a difference. The only downside is a slightly sticky residue it leaves on the hair when dry, but I gladly put up with that for the benefits.

My hair is medium blond, but now there are a whole bunch of new light blond hairs popping up between the little growth I had left before using this product.   74. Hair Loss Treatment is a complex thing. With topical minoxidil, it takes at least 3-5 months of continued used (twice daily) to achieve minimum visible effects and takes 2 years of continued used to achieve maximum results. I have not yet used this product for a continued period of 5 months or greater, so I cannot give the product 5 stars. However, the ingredient profile is very impressive and contains many scientifically proven ingredients to inhibit DHT's effect on hair follicles. I have experienced some moderate-heavy shedding with application of this product (which is expected and a sign that something is at work). I don't know what this product holds in store for me in the future but I am excited and confident to see results with prolonged use of this product.

I experienced shedding about a month in which revealed balding on the top of my head due to using the shampoo, unfortunately, but this is normal and necessary for new hair-growth to occur, and that hair would've slowly been lost on its own anyway, so better to deal with it now.<br /><br />To sum it up, it's been working even in this relatively short period of use. It seems for me, minoxidil in general worked better at the front than in the back; the back took literally four months to show growth. While the results for this product are true, I switched to an off-brand, liquid minoxidil for nighttime use, and Rogaine foam for morning use. They're better in terms of price and quantity by a lot. The Big 3 shampoo is still a product I use and love, though!<br /><br />Further note on reason for switching:<br />The shedding that revealed balding on the top of my head as well means I'll be using more of a base product, and I doubt it'll even last a month at this rate of use. The people began to grow a lot of hair and the scientists created a topical solution that when applied promotes blood flow on the capillaries and therefore brings the necessary nutrients to the hair bulb to ensure it's growth. This product does a great job at infusing Minoxidil with other vitamins and DHT blockers that create a powerful effect.   115. I have been using this product since 2012 to help mitigate hair loss in my frontal crown. At this point, I feel that the product has slowed down hair loss in my crown and its interesting to check every month or so to see how my hairline has changed. Usually I will notice shorter hair in my crown that is about 1/3 to 1/2 the length of the hair on the top of my head and that is thinner. Lately I have noticed a few of those previously shorter/thinner hairs are thick and long just like the hair on top of my head.<br /><br />My suggestion to those who use it is to follow the instructions and do not miss treatments. That sounds like a no-brainer, but if you miss applications here and there, you may notice the effectiveness plummet. I also like the new formula as it is less thick than the previous formula, its gelatinous enough for me now to help style my hair like a lightweight pomade.<br /><br />I also use a good shampoo and conditioner.   131. Great product. Been using it for years now-- about 4-5 total. It is the base for my whole hair loss regimen. I previously used generic minoxidil, but was unhappy with the itchiness, residue, and dandruff it inevitably left behind. This product--even with the composition changes it has incurred over the last few years-- does a much better job of cutting out those unwanted side effects.<br /><br />As far as the actual hair: This product has definitely made a difference. I do not think I have gained much if any hair, but my hair loss has slowed significantly. I started using this product in my early 20's when I first noticed hair loss around my temples. I knew the ubiquitous &#34;M&#34; shaped hair pattern was not too far behind. Almost every single male on both sides of my family, past and present, has suffered from baldness. Those whom are unaffected started using finasteride at a young age. I, on the other hand, stubbornly eschew use of any oral hair loss medications for reasons well documented on other sites. When I first started, I hoped a single medication would hold me over. Fast forward a half decade later later and my hair line has changed little. I have also become more astute in my hair regimen. For optimal absorption, I use a 1.5 microdermaroller. I have, also, just recently, starting mixing careprost/latisse into my bottle of lipogaine. For the hairloss junkies who pour over hair loss forums for a magical mix of potions, the lipogaine/careprost mix may be something to look into. For me, for the last three months on lipogaine/careprost, the hair shedding has decreased significantly more and the feel of my hair has changed also. I understand the uneasiness some may assume with my non-scientific speak, but as a lay person and hair loss junkie, I have to say the lipogaine/careprost regimen is compelling. At the very least, and for purposes of this review, lipogaine is a substantial foundation for any regimen you may intend to pursue.

  144. I have been using Lipogaine for about ten months and was very happy with it until about three months ago when I suddenly noticed that I was losing all the hair I had gained in the previous seven months. Of course I initially didn't blame Lipogaine until I realized that they secretly had dropped a key DHT blocker - Azelaic Acid! Now I concede that the jury is out on AA as some folks are convinced that it does very little for hair loss. Others maintain that it reduces the amount of DHT in the scalp by greater than 98%! But if they didn't believe it was working when they started out - why take it out now? And why do it without mentioning anything to their existing customers?<br /><br />Given Ockham's razor - if in doubt the hypothesis with the fewest assumptions should be selected. In other words, the simplest explanation is usually the correct one. I personally believe that this cannot be coincidence as I saw a massive improvement and regrowth until about three months ago after which I experienced increasing hairloss again. I have not changed my lifestyle in any way but that was about the same time when Lipogaine reformulated their product - this time without Azelaic Azid.<br /><br />At this point Lipogaine is nothing but an expensive 5% and sticky Minoxidil solution. I wrote them several inquiries about this but they never responded as to why they took it out. Given that I have to resort to the lowest rating possible. I don't think it's fair to cheapen a product once a brand has earned a good reputation - resting on their laurels will bite them in the rear in the end. If anyone has noticed more hair loss in the past three months please respond to this review.

  154. 26yr old male, noticed a little general thinning from the back (vertex) towards the front of the top of my head and a little recession at the temples. I started using Rogaine foam (5% Minoxodil) twice a day morning/bedtime.<br /><br />At 2-3 weeks: Hit the shedding phase which is super scary bc my hair was falling out like crazy! I wanted to stop but upon extensive internet research I confirmed this is normal and in fact means it is working. DO NOT STOP HERE! It will be in vain! Minoxidil forces your follicles into the growth phase, which begins by first shedding old strands for new ones (should last no more than 2 wks).<br /><br />4-5 weeks: My hair loss began decreasing steadily. After the 2nd Month I switched to this product since it has some extra ingredients to increase penetrance, disrupt DHT, and I wanted the best.<br /><br />Now I'm at six months...no hair loss! Haven't seen a single hair in the shower or on my book pages for months! I can see a little baby hair growth along my temples, it's hard to tell if I'm growing anywhere else yet but at least I'm not losing anymore :D From the sounds of it, regrowth takes some time.<br /><br />Application is a little tedious. I kind of put a few drops then sway my head around so it trickles about, then a few more drops, etc... I've also been taking Biotin and Saw Palmetto supplements daily, use shampoo w/ salicylic acid (Neutrogena T/Sal), and a Bosley conditioner. I highly recommend this product as part of a \\"big three\\" treatment (Minoxodil + Biotin + Antifungal shampoo). The shampoo should have either salicylic acid, or better, ketoconazole as the active ingredient. It gets expensive month after month but well, you want hair? Feel free to question/comment! Hope this helps.

It will stain fabrics (pillow cases, hats, etc) if you're not careful so keep that in mind. I've found it best to apply shortly after showering and drying hair, then removing the excess that's not absorbed into the scalp about 20 minutes later by rubbing a towel through my hair. The cost is comparable to other brands if not a bit cheaper which is another plus. All in all, this is the product that I'll continue to use to help maintain and restore my scalp hair.

Try getting info from other search engines<br /> like YAHOO, BING, ASK,DUCKDUCKGO, AOL etc. The search results vary from each other, if there is a<br /> genuine article out there, you should find it. You could take one step further and try non-English search engines, like<br /> BAIDU(from china), YANDEX (from russia). The thing is, we could use google against google, by using google translate, or<br /> Chrome web browser which translates pages for us to see foreign language pages in desired language. This method could be<br /> used not only for 'minoxidil', but for anything. As a experiment, try 'lipogaine reviews' or 'lipogaine side effects' across several<br /> search engines to evaluate the product.<br /> - should be smart in evaluating a product, use forums like hairlosstalk, hairlosshelp etc., video reviews, talk to friends with<br /> same problems<br /><br />After all this my overall feeling was, with the products like minoxidil, it is always good to follow the crowd, and be safe as much as possible. I decided to go with crowd and I am good with the results so far. Sometimes have to try product in random to see how it works for you, even if it burns your pocket. Keep an open mind, see where research is heading in the domain, and watch out for new products. So here I am with this review. Hope this helps you.
  207. Yes, I, 100%, agree with Chris G. I was actually thinking to write a review saying the same. I think they have changed something in the composition that made the initially excellent product (it worked for me excellently in as little time as 3 months) almost a useless. If you observe, most of the early reviews were very positive.<br /><br />I also suspect there may be some fake Lipogaine sellers in the market. After I use the product for about 2 to 3 months (sometime in March 2013), I clearly observed significant new hair growth (better than I expected), even at frontal hairline. Before that time, I had been trying almost every hair regrowth product in the market. I saw some significant hair regrowth with Finesteride but at a cost of some serious sexual side effect which prompted me to stop using it. Lipogaine was the best product for me until couple of months ago.<br /><br />It looks like Lipogaine is no longer doing its job. By the way, when the product was actually working, I did experience a side effect. My eyes were becoming little blurred after each time I apply Lipogaine to my scalp. Now, no more blurred eyes and of course no more hair regrowth too. In fact, I have lost some previously regrown (by lipogaine itself) hair.<br /><br />Before I say good bye to you guys, I would like to share my another relevant observation with either any generic Minoxidil or even with Lipogaine. I guess, these formulations contain some kind of instant hair thickening agents which just stick (coat) to hair shafts and make the hair thicker. This temporary hair thickening effect goes away after subsequent hair wash. I think this temporary thickening effect is what is keeping some fake hair regrowth products in the market (of course at least temporarily :)).

I am not sure when I can see new growth of hairs but azelaic acid immediately stops current hair loss and help retains natural hairs. Sooner you start using DHT blocker, better volume of hair you can maintain.<br /><br />Retinol - Dont like stinking foam or any other way for minoxidil. Retinol is best base to get minoxidil in odorless 1 ml of liquid drop. Now you can use minoxidil every day and still keep it unnoticeable in your family.<br /><br />Biotin - I never saw biotin in previous minoxidil solutions I used. My dermatotologist once prescribed me biotin capsules to prevent hair loss. Happy to have it included in my minoxidil.<br /><br />Saw palmetto - Even this I never had in other minoxidil solutions. Heard that saw palmetto is natural herbal to block DHT. Thanks to Lipogaine to include this as well in same bottle of minoxidil.<br /><br />After a month of use, my hair loss is very minimal. Prevention is better than cure, I prevented further hair loss and ensured rate of hair loss is less than or atleast equal to rate of new hair growth. Minoxidil will continue its work and reduce the possibility of having a bald patch in coming years.<br /><br />Overall, I highly recommend Lipogaine minoxidil for men. Minoxidil is same minoxidil in every brand. But with lipogaine, you get best combo of DHT blockers to reduce loss of your existing hairs, contains effective nutrition (vitamins) to nourish hair, with retinol which is best and cleanest way to absorb minoxidil and finally with a company you can trust to have good quality control.

  316. I've been using Lipogaine for about 6 months now and I have definitely noticed a slow in the rate my hair has been thinning. As for new hair growth, I haven't seen much in the way of that. My thin hair is still the same as when I first started using the product which could be a con for some consumers but I look at it as a plus. I don't expect to ever find a magical cure for my hair to grow and become thicker than ever; I'm just looking for a product to slow my hair loss until I feel I am a reasonable age to be bald (I'm currently 22). If you're looking for a product to slow your thinning hair this might be worth a shot. Just make sure to use it properly, and make sure it dries before you fall asleep, it is a terrible experience to get in your eyes. In the mean time, if you want to make your hair cosmetically look fuller in a flash try Toppik Hair Building Fibers. That product hides my thinning crown in a flash. In combination with Lipogaine I feel I still have hope. Thanks for reading.

  322. Just finished my fifth bottle. There has been some regrowth, but I don't have the typical top-of-head bald spot that they say it works best with. I have thinning down the middle, and it doesn't work as well for that type of balding. I am using a hair-loss DHT blocking shampoo in conjunction with it. As others have said, it can get a little crusty, especially the second application after washing your hair (it's not good to wash your hair more than once per day). However, it does dry faster than regular minoxidil. I guess that's the tradeoff. But I'd rather have my hair a little crustier (can always say it is hair gel) than have to get up 30 minutes earlier in the morning to allow more drying time.<br /><br />Tip: it is a little yellow/orange in color, so make sure you apply it an hour before going to bed to give it time to dry. Or switch to beige/tan or black colored pillowcases.
  323. My son orders this product Lipogane for Men. He has taken before and after pictures and the product really does work. His self esteem has returned as well as the hair that he had loss. He continues the product as a form of maintanence.
  324. I started using this product along with Lipogaine's shampoo and Kirkland's Minoxidil 5% about 2 months ago after reading this guy's seemingly successful routine for hair loss treatment ([...]). I try to be consistent in my usage but it's not always easy. Most days of the week I apply both the Lipogaine and Kirkland Minoxidil once each. Which one is applied at what time just depends on the day really. Bottom line is I try to wait anywhere from 10 to 16 hours between applications. I just ordered my third bottle of Lipogaine after running out so I'll be strictly on the minoxidil for a couple days. My hair loss is evident to anyone who glances at me. My hair line recedes pretty far and my temple is balding the worst, but the entire top of my head is also very thin. So far, I have experienced pretty much no visible change. There may be just a few new hairs at the front of my scalp, but you really have to take a look up close to notice. I haven't really entered a phase of increased shedding, which apparently is supposed to occur before legitimate regrowth. However, my hair loss hasn't slowed down either. I'm still going to give this another half year at least probably, but I've gone through this before with a different minoxidil product and that didn't work after 6 months or so. Though, I am trying to be more persistent with my usage this time around. I'm also on a Saw Palmetto supplement and I take a vitamin powder from GNC which has all kinds of stuff in it. As far as side effects are concerned, I have one and it's annoying...flakes. I thought it was dandruff at first, which I haven't had badly in the past at all, and now I'm certain it's just flakes from the dried product(s). There isn't really any itchiness or irritation (although I was a little itchy for some minutes after only my first usage), it's just flakes. I've read about other side effects that don't make sense to me such as wrinkly skin or lacking libido. I've always looked a little old for my age butthat's just how I am, I don't look extra old from putting this on my scalp and certainly am not lacking libido from it. Anyway, giving this a 3 for the moment because it's too early to knock it. Taking pictures every several weeks which I'll try to post if I ever have success with this, but again, so far not much change.

  350. I've used Rogaine and then generic Minoxidil for a few years, to pretty decent results -- hair stopped failing out as much. I stopped using it for probably a three-month period maybe two years ago, and the balding accelerated greatly. Despite returning to it, I was never able to regain my previous coverage. I am in my late 30s.<br /><br />I had two areas of hair loss -- a triangle roughly 2.5 inches in size on my right forehead, and then on that same side, in the back and top of my head. It necessitated a come-over of sorts.<br /><br />I decided to try Lipogaine. After two weeks, there were signs of thickening hair. I am on my third bottle (over about six months) and I'm about 75 percent to total coverage, the kind of thick hair I had in my early twenties. I use Lipogaine once or twice a day, sometimes using leftover Minoxidil to complement it and as a styling agent.<br /><br />There is a learning curve in how to apply it so you hair doesn't look too matted. I've had bad hair days because of the gummy feel of this once it dries. You have to get it on your skin, not the hair. Well worth the effort, however.<br /><br />In summary, this is a product that has significantly improved my quality of life. If you are curious, I would buy a bottle, try it everyday and see if you see any benefit, as probably not everyone responds to it. It has worked for me, luckily.

  352. Very strong, effective solution to grow hair on my receding hairline. Seems to have noticeable impact within one month, started to see hairs growing back. It seriously is very strong and sometimes causes the affected areas of my head to itch and produce a lot of dandruff flakes. At one point, I was getting severe dry skin all over my ears and face so I stopped using it for about a week. After I recovered, I really wanted to try it again and so I started just doing it once a day (morning). I was getting some new hairs to stick around now, but need more to make the area thicker. So now I'm back to twice a day and am seeing good progress again. I learned to apply only a very thin layer of the product each time and to rinse it off after letting it sit for at least 4 hours to prevent flakiness, and definitely rinse it off before going to bed. I also take supplement pills (http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00MMA7W5C?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_5) to help with the hair growth and hair health, but I feel this topical treatment alone is enough to get it done.

  363. I started using Lipogaine about September of 2012. Within about 2 months, the constant hair loss I was experiencing over the previous few/several years had stopped. From that point until about April of 2013 I saw a wonderful amount of regrowth. Regrowth meaning that areas of my scalp that had very little hair left, were repopulated significantly (not fully), giving me coverage, and other thin areas were now thick/dense as it used to be. I was rather amazed at the point, and had my first sigh of relief and hope since the last few/several years. I was also doing scalp/galea loosening exercises during this time, some home low-light-laser therapy (LLLT), as well as consuming 2-4 teaspoons of flaxseed oil a day. (A tight scalp may reduce blood flow through the capillary network for the hair.)<br /><br />Unfortunately, sometime in April progress seemed to stop, and I might have experienced a bit of hair loss again thereafter. I lost some faith in my routine, although perhaps it was just temporary (There might be a pattern of spring-time hair loss for me). Also, I had read that for some men minoxidil works for a while then somehow loses effectiveness. I thought maybe that was happening. Because of that and the irritation and itching I experience from Lipogaine (learned later that I was applying too much). I began reducing my application to once a day, and became complacent and inconsistent with it, while focusing on scalp exercises. Over several more months I noticed a slight decline in density, but not overly concerned. 2014 was pretty much the same – inconsistent application, scalp exercises, and LLLT, while realizing slow thinning and loss of density.<br /><br />In late December 2014, I stopped applying Lipogaine completely. Sometime in late February I began to shed significantly. It is now mid April and I have lost a lot, and still shedding. This might be one of my worst points in hair loss, and very concerned. Needless to say, I’ve started back on Lipogaine, however applying less than I did before over the scalp. This has reduced the itchiness. I’ll see what happens from here. Based on my experience, I think Lipogaine can have a significant positive regrowth effect (if even for a time), and at the least can significantly slow thinning and loss of density.<br /><br />Note what others have said about applying Lipogaine. Try to apply it directly to the scalp. You don’t need very much on the scalp, and in a minute you’ll see it absorb into the skin. I keep the dropper/applicator out of the bottle, and put only the tip in when drawing some out. This keeps the solution off of the glass applicator, and thus, less gets in your hair.

  384. I have been using this product for about eight months now. The initial results were promising, and I continue to grow light hair. However, the new growth does not stay. Much of the new growth falls out again, so it appears that I have reached a plateau. It has definitely slowed the thinning process and has generally helped me to maintain my hair. Lipogaine does not do this. It is sticky, not unlike a styling product. But that is to be expected. I will continue to use Lipogaine, as it is the best Minox product that I have found thus far.

I was very pleased thinking if I continue using this product I will eventually have a full head of hair. Unfortunately after month 4 there was no improvement and this continues to be the case after 7 months. So in a nutshell it is not a long term solution and I am now contemplating having an fue transplant! A word of caution if buying lipogaine, one bottle will not last anything like the 4 weeks it suggests!

I rarely use styling products because this stuff asks like it's own styling product if you catch it towards the very end of drying and rub gently with a towel. Also, not only does it have the active ingredient of minoxidil that increases blood flow to the area, but also other ingredients that like saw palmetto that help seed the scalp for hair growth as well. I was 21 when I started using Lipogaine and have been for about 2 years now. I noticed results after about the first 3 months when it seemed my hair stopped falling out and baby hairs were noticeable. After 6 is when friends and my girlfriend started mentioning that my hair appeared to be thicker and fuller. Before I had to keep my hair very short in order not to accentuate my thinning, but now I can go to a barber and enjoy getting an undercut done. In order to truly get results and not lose them, you have to be strict on using Lipogaine twice a day EVERYDAY, otherwise it will stop working, and in fact your body will seem to want to make up for lost time and encourage your hair to fall out faster. After combining the topical solution with the Big 3 shampoo, I have noticed that the my hair completely stops shedding altogether, nothing on my fingers when i run my hands through my hair in the shower.   418. My story is very complicated, so please bare with me<br /><br />In June 2013, I received an ACL reconstruction, which led to Telogen Effluvium. My family has a long history of baldness or somewhere close to baldness, so I knew genetics was a primary cause. My hair became so thin and hairline receded tremendously, so I jumped on finasteride (brand name Propecia) and Lipogaine in October. After being on finasteride for 2 months, I could not take the initial shed+depression anymore, so I dropped finasteride in December. I continued using Lipogaine until now. I saw major regrowth until March, but started seeing a lot of shedding starting April.<br /><br />My hair is almost back to where I started October 2013, and shedding is still going on. In addition to shedding, my scalp feels itchy as hell, tingles every minute, and feels irritated all the time. I am taking natural supplements currently such as vitamin B complex, MSM, silica, iodine, iron, and biotin.<br /><br />The worst thing about this product is that it affects your sexual desire and mood. I have used this product for longer than 7 months and now I do not have much sexual desire. My libido is fine, but I don't feel like having sex or masturbate. I've never had this issue until recently. Also, please keep in mind that low sexual desire/change in mood started simultaneously with increased shedding. Shedding has been going on for approximately two months. There are tons of posts about low sexual desire from Lipogaine when you search on Google. I was very skeptical of those comments, but now I know for a fact that this product is the culprit. I am returning the last bottle I have. If you want to use this product, please use it for 6 months or less.<br /><br />Disclaimer: I am not a doctor, so do not take my words as recommendation. Do your due diligence please.

  518. I decided to take a risk and purchase this product for use on my receding hairline, despite mixed reviews from others who say that minoxidil-based products will not help a receding hairline (typically for the crown area only). I began using it in June, 2012, and as of October, 2012 I have seen some minor results. After about a month of use I experienced the minoxidil \\"shedding.\\" If you are a potential buyer and are worried about this, please don't be, it stopped after a couple weeks and left no visible thinning of hair in the process. Afterwards, I began to notice some very fine \\"peachfuzz\\" growing in the areas where I have been applying the Lipogaine. It has been a few more months since then, and although progress is very slow, it is still progress, and at the very least my hairline has stopped receding. At the time of this review (October, 2012) there is some minor-moderate regrowth, but nothing substantial yet.<br /><br />Lipogaine gets 3 stars for being able to do this despite warnings to the contrary, it falls short of getting 4 or even 5 stars because the product is quite messy. It leaves a sticky, and later a dry, crusty residue on the application site. About an hour after applying it my hair feels like I applied a gel-based hair product. If you do not scrub your scalp hard during a shower the residue can build up quickly, leaving a visible layer. However, I have seen some results and would recommend at least trying it to see if it works for you. One bottle seems to last me about 25 days if applied per the directions, and as I said, it has taken a few months to achieve visible results. I will keep purchasing it and hoping for more substantial regrowth in the future.<br /><br />Update as of June 2013: I have since discontinued using this product in favor of Rogaine foam. It appears to perform the same job with none of the messy residue. No additional regrowth noticed over the past 12 months.

I panicked. I was still loosing hair and balding in the front really fast. I came across Lipogaine on Amazon and after reading the reviews I decided to give it a try. I would run my hand through my hair after my shower and instead of seeing 5 or six strands between my fingers, now I saw nothing. I kept applying Lipogaine to my hairline and front religiously twice a day, and the results were slow but steady. This is the only product I use and I know it is responsible for the positive results. 2 years later I still apply it twice a day and my hair keeps on getting a little thicker. Nobody would now say that I am balding, when people commented how I was just 2 years ago.<br />It works, it needs time and consistency I guess, but it does stop your hair from falling out, and promotes growth of new hair.

  548. I have the beginning stages of frontal (horse shoe) balding and the classic male pattern loss of hair on the crown of the head. Additionally I had a prominent bald spot forming in the front middle portion of the \\"horseshoe.\\" I've been a loyal Rogaine foam user for the last 5-6 years but after noticing that my hairline was still receding (slowly) I decided to try something new.<br /><br />After about 2 months I noticed that the newly formed bald spot had thickened up and mostly grown back. My hair looks and feels thicker. I've actually had the confidence to grow my hair out a little more after about 3 months of using Lipogaine--which is really nice! The only downside is the price, one bottle goes quick. I use a little more than the recommended dosage (1mL) because I apply it on the back and front of my head, so one bottle winds up lasting me about 3 weeks instead of 1 month. The other negative aspect of Lipogaine is the \\"gel\\" effect it has on my hair. After applying the product my hair becomes rigid and fixed as if I applied a liberal amount of gel. This can be avoided by applying a dab of pomade a few minutes after the Lipogaine is applied.<br /><br />The take away: This is a good product that works. It's a little expensive for the quantity, but the quality makes it worth it. Again, I've been using Rogaine for years, but I think the DHT blocker in Lipogaine was the extra umph I needed to stave off hairloss for the time being.

So for those out there using it, keep an eye on your chest (gyno) and systemic side effects because even know its a topical it DOES GET ABSORBED into the bloodstream. I will probably retry topical spiro but not sure its as good as azelaic acid.

  570. Hi All,<br /><br />I'll just get straight to the point. I'm into my 3rd week of using Lipogaine after doing months of research on all the products:<br /><br />Method of use:<br />1. Apply twice a day (1ml for day and 1ml for night) --> Some days I've actually applied 0.75ml instead.<br />2. I shampoo my hair every 2nd or 3rd day depending.<br />3. I've used the dropper and applied it to areas on the top of my scalp and then simply tilted my head side/side, back/front so the solution is covering the surrounding areas.<br />4. For my hairline, I've use my finger to rub some of the solution onto the hairline.<br /><br />So far:<br />1. Dries very quickly<br />2. The product is not sticky at all. If you're finding it very sticky then you're obviously applying too much onto the one area.<br />3. I had significant dandruff in the first few days, it was very noticeable. Since then I've noticed hardly any dandruff. I'm not sure if it was because of the way I applied the product in the first week or whether the product has adapted to my scalp *shrugs*<br />4. As expected, I noticed a lot of shedding as soon as I used the product. I'm into my 3rd week now, and over the last two days I think the shedding has slowed down somewhat.<br />5. On the odd occasion, I did experience slight itching but not to the point where I had to scratch my scalp silly.<br />6. Have yet to see any hair regrowth but i'm still way too early into the product.<br /><br />What I am hoping for over the next few weeks or months:<br />1. Some noticeable hair regrowth and thickness<br />2. The shedding to either stop or significantly slow down.<br /><br />Based on the product descriptions and reviews from various sources and how it is so far matching up to my own experiences, I'm giving this product 3 stars for now.<br /><br />I will continue to update you all as I progress. Feel free to provide any tips or advice or comments.<br /><br />WISH ME LUCK!!<br /><br />Peace out!

  574. Review below is for the OLD FORMULA with Azelaic acid. Started the review of the new formula at 'Month ten.' You can check out my progress below but bottom line- this stuff works. Yes, it is expensive but did i mention it works? This is far superior to Rogaine or any generic minoxidil. Some of the negative reviews seem to be from people that are not CONSISTENTLY using the product for six months or have an allergic reaction to minoxidil in general. If you're not seeing some improvement after three months, sorry to say, you might be a lost cause. Give it a shot! Background- I'm probably at stage 3v on the handy 'baldness' chart. (noticeable loss in the back. Have always had a high hairline but it's getting higher every year). Family history- No male in my family has a decent hair line. Not bald and nobody starts balding early but by 50yrs old there's substantial loss. This goes for both sides of my fam. Past hair loss treatments- I used minoxidil (generic) for about a year or more. It worked very very well. Saw some decent regrowth. Was actually pretty happy with my hairline. Had to stop because it was destroying my scalp. Dandruff and heavy irritation. After stopping, I pretty much lost all of the regrowth within about six months. Not willing to use finasteride. Am currently using [[ASIN:B0032FSDOA Regenepure DR - Hair & Scalp Treatment 8.0 fl. oz.]] and taking two [[ASIN:B0009EXLOO Nature's Way Saw Palmetto, 60 Softgels]]every day in tandem with Lipogaine. Lipogaine usage- religiously applying two times a day or every 8hrs (some times I get three applications in a day). Overall thoughts on Lipogaine- really like the consistency of the liquid. Nice and thick. Really stays where you need it to. It doesn't irritate my scalp at all. It does tend to make the hair a little 'straw' like and 'ashy'. It is very very sticky if you apply to wet hair (which you shouldn't do anyway). As far as application and product quality it's great. That being said, styling your hair after applying is tricky. As others have said it is very greasy. This greasiness weighs down the hair and unfortunately can make you look balder. Have not experienced a shortage of supply during the month- using 1ml twice a day, one bottle made it to almost exactly a month. Progress: After two weeks- I'm in the dreaded 'shedding' phase. Ahhhhh! It is truly horrifying. The first week or so wasn't so bad. Then, almost two weeks to the day, it seems like it's shedding all at once. Apparently, some guys skip this phase altogether. Apparently, I'm not one of those guys. I don't remember it being this bad the last time I started Minoxidil but I may have emotionally blocked it out. I feel like a tree in Fall time. I've taken to showering at night so I don't have to see how much hair is going down the drain. After showering, I fully expect to wipe the fog from the mirror and see a bald man starring back. So, far he hasn't showed up... yet. I try to visualize fresh new hairs sprouting under the ones that have fallen. Visualization can only calm you down so much. Thanks to reviews here and other forums, I am staying strong and keeping on. Thank you, my balding brothers. One month - still shedding. Seems to have slowed a little but not much. That being said, I'm also seeing some regrowth up front. Small dark hairs combined with long darkish peach fuzz. Looks like there could be some light regrowth around the crown but hard to tell right now. The saga continues... Six weeks- Shedding has slowed to a crawl. Definitely seeing growth in the front. Some of this is what I lost in 'the shed' but there is a lot where hair hasn't grown in a while. Very very encouraging. Back is still looking thin. Will probably have to wait a few more months to see real noticeable results back there. -Bumping the stars up to four today. I'm lovin the Lipogaine right now. Twelve Weeks - Bumping it up to five stars today. Incredible results. Have grown back all the hair lost in shedding and seeing more hair in places that hasn't grown for years. Pet peeve- ordered three more bottles and only got one applicator dropper. Don't know if they only include one for increments of three bottles (like Rogaine) or there's only one dropper for all orders (regardless of the number of bottles). Either way- for the amount of money you spend on this stuff, you should get a dropper per bottle (and somebody to apply it- but that's beside the point). Multiple dropper or no- this stuff is working great. Hoping to look like Clark Kent in a few more months. Four Months - Still going strong here. For the first time in a long time, I'm confidant enough to go out with out a hat or hair concealer. Basically, just waiting on the new hairs to grow more. Sill could use a little work in the crown area (believe me, it's night and day better than it was- just getting nit picky). Don't know how much better it can get. At this point, I'm expecting my 16-year-old hairline to come back. (That might be a little unrealistic). Started using the [[ASIN:B004FT0ZJ8 Microneedle Skin Care System 1.0 mm Derma Roller with Medical Grade Stainless Steel]] before applying Lipogaine at night. Seem to be getting a little peach fuzz on the edge of the hairline in front. Not sure if this will turn into thick hair but it's very encouraging. Also, taking [[ASIN:B0009EXLOO Nature's Way Saw Palmetto, 60 Softgels]] (one in the morning, one in the afternoon). Hair loss in the shower basically stopped completely after taking the Saw Palmetto for a week. Know these should be under separate reviews but in my opinion there is no one magic bullet. You must have a multi-pronged battle plan if you want to defeat the evil Hair Loss Menace. Five months - Today was the first day my barber noticed the hair progress. He just kept going on and on about it. &#34;I can't believe it! You're a success story. I can comb your hair back. This is incredible!&#34; Needless to say, it was a huge confidence boast. It also confirmed my own observations (I sound like a scientist). I had thought my growth had plateaued but looking again I'm seeing a whole new line of hairs up front - some of that 'peach fuzz' turned into thick long hair. I'm going to attribute this to that Microneedle. Didn't see those sprouts till I started using it. Still would like to see some more growth in the crown area. Don't get me wrong, the growth up there is unbelievable- I can conceal what's missing without the use of product... Lipogaine's got my hopes super high at this point. Obviously, I'm in love with this product and wanna have like ten thousand of its babies but the results ARE incredible. In less than six months I went from &#34;balding old man&#34; to &#34;high-hairline young guy.&#34; I know I will never be &#34;teenager with awesome hair&#34; but &#34;handsome man with good hair&#34; will work for me. -----------------------------------------------------NEW FORMULA Ten months - WHY WOULD YOU CHANGE THE FORMULA??!!! Started shedding again! Bleh! Started almost immediately after started the new formula. Not as intense as the first time around but still significant. Dropped the rating down to three for the moment. Things better improve. ----------------------------------------------------UPDATE After 2nd shed, everything seems to be growing smoothly now. Still feel the original formula was better. Still the best on the market in terms of growing hair and not drying out your scalp. I honestly can't use some of the other products out there because they dry the scalp so much. Continuing to use Lipogaine on a daily basis.

  580. I have been a Lipogaine customer for quite some time now. For the front, thinning stopped but the replacement was not as robust. These results were way more than I expected and I have continued use of Lipogaine over the past several years, completely satisfied that it is both reliable and has consistent quality.   582. Hey everyone,<br /><br />Bought a few bottles from here starting this year. This product is isn't any different from the other products in the marketplace. It does work to some effect, but honestly you can have the same effects from using generic minoxidil. Don't bother wasting $30 every month, buy generic 5% minoxidil (Kirkland from Cost Co or Walmart's Equate 5% extra strength minoxidil). Then buy a micro needle from ebay (got mine for $16) and buy some 5% azelaic acid (DHT inhibitor) online or in store. I first run the micro needle on my scalp and then apply the minoxidil and azelaic acid. I've been doing this for about 4 months now and I'm experiencing AWESOME regrowth on my scalp and saving a lots of money!!. I'm using the Kirkland generic 5% minoxidil brand, which costs me $26 for a 6 month supply.   583. I have been using Lipogaine since November 2012 after hearing about it on the \\"Hairlossfromsteroids.com\\" website. This review is only to address my opinion of Lipogaine.<br /><br /> I believe Lipogaine significantly reduces hair loss. I still have some shedding from shampooing in the shower/bath. But when I put gel and style my hair, I really don't notice much shedding at all, as compared to in 2001 when I was 20 and really noticed significant shedding when styling my hair. I think this product works better the more frequently it is on the scalp. I cannot attest to any regrowth to Lipogaine as I had a hair transplant several months prior to using Lipogaine. In my opinion, Lipogaine is the best 1st mechanism of defense towards androgenic alopecia, especially for young guys in high school/college that are just beginning to loose their hair. The reason I believe this is because I think the azelaic acid kills DHT, and having it penetrated into the scalp for extended periods of time kills more DHT than any of the ketoconazole shampoos that are also clinically proven to kill DHT. I have never used any other minoxadil formula, so I can't compare it to Rogaine or any other generic minoxadil. With all products there is usually a downside.... and maybe I just have higher, or even unrealistic expectations of products than other people. But Lipogaine does leave a sticky substance feel even when it is dried, and when I put gel in after the Lipogaine, it just doesn't blend well with the Lipogain and kinda leaves residue of white balls/dots throughout my hair. However, I still think using it once a day, maybe before bed or any time you are going to be at home for even a couple hours Lipogaine can be beneficial to reducing hairloss. I will continue using Lipogaine until a better product comes around. Also, Lipogain puts in a lot of other ingredients I am not convinced work such as saw palmetto, niacin, biotin, vitamin b6 and B12, and some other crap that I personally think if leftout might help the styling aspect and decrease the sticky residue.
  584. I have been using this product for over two years now. While it hasn't restored all of my hair, it has definitely prevented any further hair loss. Plus my hair does seem a bit thicker... I recommend trying it out for six months. What do you have to lose! Hopefully no more hair!!

  587. Lipogaine is part of an industry that is well known to over promise and under deliver. And I imagine because of that it's hard to stand out from the pack. But, for me, Lipogaine has delivered.<br /><br />I've always had relatively fine hair but a lot of it. It started to thin a bit in my early 40's, along with a receding hairline, and I decided to do something about it. For me it was a doctor prescribed combination of Minoxidal and Propecia and I saw results. But after about a year I started paying attention to the side effects that were becoming more well known and was having a hard time justifying the cost. Eventually, when I stopped, the gains I had seen diminished and I found my hat collection growing.<br /><br />I'm a very active person and just didn't feel comfortable with my hair not 'matching' the way I felt. So I started looking around and discovered Lipogaine. There's no question that the number of positive reviews here on Amazon helped me pull the trigger but, in all honesty, I wasn't expecting a miracle. I figured I'd try it for three months and take it from there.<br /><br />While it hasn't been an overnight miracle I can say that, without a doubt, my hair is thicker than when I started the process about six months ago. My main focus now is to see if I can inch my hairline down a bit. I've seen enough success there to stick with it and am confident that it will continue to work.<br /><br />And while it might be different for some, I've found that the solution itself dries quickly and actually seems to add a little body on its own. Super fast and easy to apply and it's simple to work in to your normal routine.<br /><br />I know that with products like this it may work for some and not for others.   629. 1st, foam doesn't work for me because my hair is too thin to style. I love Lipogaine because it's easier to apply than liquid Rogaine. It's not as runny and thus doesn't just poor down my head when I'm trying to use it. The end result is I don't end up having to rewash my hair and thus don't have to wait 30 minutes for the Rogaine to soak in before I can even rewash my hair.<br /><br />2nd, Scalp Itch and dandruff are a side effect of the DHT experience for me. When I took Rogaine or Propecia the itch always went away. This product too has removed the itch.<br /><br />Lastly, I don't know if I'm losing hair still or if I'm growing hair back, my hair is naturally thin so it's difficult to tell.<br /><br />It should be noted than it's commonly beleived that a DHT blocker is good along with rogaine(minoxidil), this product contains a DHT Blocker. Last I knew, how Rogaine works is not well understood so the view of a Blocker's importance is just a matter of trial and error from folks on the internet.<br /><br />I originally found Lipogaine on youtube by some guy with the handle hairlossfromsteroids or something like that. The guy definitely wasn't a scientist but his videos make sense, steroid induced hairloss. If you beleive him he has some good pictures showing how bad his hair loss got and his huge recovery. Keep in mind his hair loss was chemically induced so his huge recovery is not the same as recovering from years of hair loss.<br /><br />Warning for Propecia and maybe other oral DHT Blocker users - Plain and simple, it turns out that while Testosteone is the male hormone for some parts of the body, DHT is the male hormone for others. The result is that people have reported many of the same side effects as other drugs that effect DHT levels (like steroids) including weight gain and erectile dysfunction. I struggled with weight gain and Erectile Dysfunction for years. Someone mentioned a 60 minutes episode detailing Propecia as a verified casue of ED and possibly other health issues. While I knew \\"mild\\" erectile dysfuntion side effects were possible with propecia I was told that they were \\"mild\\", \\"uncommon\\", and \\"usually went away over time\\". In fact there were times when I missed my pills for a week and saw no change. My family doctor said maybe it was because I was now 30 and carrying some extra weight. My urologist told me it was psychological because the Viagra he had me try worked thus showing that my plumbing was good. Long story short, two months after I stopped taking Propecia my Erectlye Dysfunction is FINALLY gone and I'm losing almost a pound a week without changing my habits. I'm still having symptoms commonly attributable to a shrunken Prostate so guys I recommend staying clear of Propecia. At the least, if you are considering Propecia, I recommend doing a Google Search on \\"Propecia Side Effects\\".

  659. I'm absolutely at what difference a product can do when you stick to it. Male Pattern Baldness runs in my family. My dad went bald when he was at the age of 31 and I can start to see it in my brother. I started losing hair when I was at the age of 22 (there was a slight noticeable difference). It was embarassing for my own friends to say to me &#34;you're starting to bald.&#34; As self conscious as I was, I really needed to do something about it. I've tried many different products such as Rogaine or generic minoxidil. But nothing worked! All it really did was leave an inflamed scalp that I couldn't stop scratching (Leading to further hairloss). I read some review on this product &#34;Lipogaine,&#34; which at first I was very skeptical about. I did my research and found that the ingredients in this product promoted healthy hair. You have biotin which is a key essential b vitamin to promote healthy hair to saw palmetto which reduces the amount of dht buildup within the hair follicle. What also sold me was the fact that unlike rogaine, Lipogaine does not use alcohol. Alcohol is a skin irritant which causes redness of the scalp. I couldn't stand using Rogaine because it left my head itchy for weeks after I stopped using it. I couldn't stop scratching and I would notice at least 30 to 40 strands of hair the next morning. Over the few months of using this product, I actually started to regrow my hair! It wasn't like elvis presley thick but I was starting to regrow some of my hair. A few months past and these hairs eventually started getting thicker and thicker! My barber even told me &#34;you're lucky you have a full set of hair.&#34; It was comments like this that I was getting that made me want to continue buying Lipogaine. I recommend any who is worried about baldness to try this product out. Even if you're not balding or MPB does not run in your family. Use it as a preventative. Regrowing hair isn't something that happens overnight. It's a long process that requires a lot of patience. But I could say after 8 months to a year, I've seen positive results!

  689. I've been using Lipogaine now regularly for over a year and I think I can finally write a thorough review of the product.<br /><br />I'm a 27 year old half-white, half-asian male, I began seeing distinct hair loss on the top of the head at 21 years old. I'm the first one in my family to have this problem, and it was localized to just the crown (it thins uniformly over a 5-inch diameter patch at the top of my scalp). I used a combination of different approaches, Eastern, Western, Holistic, everything to try to slow the process for the first 4 years, including Rogaine and Rogaine foam, and when I was 25 I switched to just using Lipogaine. I apply it twice a day, morning and night, and have not missed any days since I started.<br /><br />During the first 3 months I did not notice any increase in hair, which is normal.<br />During the first 4-5 months I noticed the largest increase in hair from using the product (about 20% improvement).<br />During the first 6-8 months hair continued to increase but slowed down (about 10% improvement).<br />After the first 8 months, I have not noticed any continued improvement, and have actually seen some of the hair recede from the &#34;peak benefit&#34; time, albeit not at the same high rate as before I started using Lipogaine.<br /><br />I would like to add that if you are doing anything in your life that requires you to get very little sleep, or gives you a large amount of stress, like a very demanding job or school, you will probably not see results from any hair restoration project. I've seen my hair fluctuate even while using this product due to lack of sleep. Also, make sure you switch to a shampoo that doesn't contain SLS. I've seen most of the new hair from this go away in just a week from going back to a shampoo with SLS, only to come back very slowly once I'd switched back to a natural shampoo.<br /><br />The product itself is quite easy to apply - I'd recommend using the dropper to squeeze little bits at a time out all overdifferent affected areas of the scalp and rubbing it in right afterward. It stings if it drips down into your eyes, so make sure you apply while looking in a mirror so you can see if a stray drop is heading in that direction. It does make the hair rather sticky/greasy, and seems to attract certain flying insects while outdoors. This, to me, is still all favorable to having the hair lost entirely. It also seems slightly less greasy than Rogaine or Rogaine foam, and washes out with just water. If you are using Caboki or Toppik at the same time as this, it will likely cause the concealer to clump up and not look very convincing.<br /><br />The results have not been &#34;magic&#34; by any stretch of the imagination. I still have very thin hair at the top of my head. What Lipogaine has done has been to slow down the process of thinning, so that it is about where it was at when I was 24. In percentage terms, the hair appears to be about 30% fuller than when I started, but has now started to recede again slowly. I am still giving the product 5 stars though, since it is literally the only thing I've found that's had any impact on my hair.
  690. I started using Lipogaine a little over a year ago to put a stop to my receding hairline and noticed positive results a little over 2 months in. I most definitely recommend this product with a combination of finasteride and anti balding shampoos. It started working on my hair pretty quickly. at first it increases your hair loss a little bit. then thin hair grows and gradually they get more and thicker. in the first weeks I usually dropped a little of the liquid on my forehead by accident and even my forehead started to grow dark thin hair. after about two month the top and front of my head was almost 70% full and after 4 month it was almost 90% full of hair. many people have appreciated my treatment and asked my what I use.<br /><br />ps: the shampoo you use with it is very important.   712. i just wanted to post a review for all of you guys out there that are looking for a hair loss product that actually works, this is it!!!. I have been using lipogaine for almost a 2 years, and thanks to this product i was able to maintain, and improve greatly the quality of my hair, i highly recommend it.
  713. I have used \\"Lipogaine for men\\" on and off in the past, with stints Iasting anywhere between 4 to 6 months. However, as of the time of writing of this review, I have been using this product regularly for the past 3 months. So far, from what I have experienced, it has helped me maintain existing hair and thickened them up a bit (no visible regrowth though). Hair-loss falls in the category of progressive diseases, the kind that get worse as time passes by. It takes a while to notice loss of hair, once hair-loss has started, and significantly longer to see any improvements on beginning treatment.<br /><br />From my personal experience of hair-loss products, tried and tested minoxidil containing products work good when combined with something that can halt the progression of hair-loss (such as propecia) and supplements that provide the necessary nutrients for hair growth. Now, \\"Lipogaine for men\\" is on the expensive side as far as minoxidil formulations are concerned, but it does boast of liposomal delivery vehicles which in theory are supposed to enhance the trans-dermal uptake of minoxidil on the scalp. Additionally it also contains biotin - a well known promoter of healthy hair growth, saw palmetto extract - a proven albeit weak blocker of di-hydro testosterone (DHT) synthesis and other components. I have personally tried several treatments in the past, and I found that this product is a good over-the-counter option at maintaining existing hair. In the past three months of usage, I have also seen noticeable thickening of my existing hair (I have been using propecia and hair nutrient supplements from Solaray as well).<br /><br />As is common with minoxidil formulations, upon initiation of treatment one usually experiences accelerated hair-shedding. My personal experience with this product was no different; for the first two months of using \\"Lipogaine for men\\" I witnessed an increase in hair-shedding to the point where my scalp hair began to look wispier than usual (and I had to resort to extra dabs of Caboki and Dermmatch). But after the two months, hair shedding reduced to normal and in the past few weeks my hair has come back thicker than before (my fiance was the one who noticed it first). This product does not have any fragrance, but it takes a while to dry off and sometimes leaves the hair a bit coarse after drying off. I personally think that's a pro as it makes my hair feel stronger (I usually wear my hair short, people with longer hair might find this to be a problem, but putting it on while the scalp is still damp seems to solve it). So, all in all, I am happy with this product and will definitely recommend it to anyone suffering from hair-loss, this is the next best thing to 10% Minoxidil (which requires a prescription and has the added dis-advantage of not being very heart healthy).

And then a friend told me about Finasteride, a real medication tested in real labs with a real FDA approval with real results. And by the way, Finasteride is a generic form of Propecia. If you have insurance it will cost you about $5 a month, instead of $25 for lipogaine, $45 for viciscal, and $30 for rogaine. Finasteride is also used as a prostate deflamation treatment, but for hair loss you cut the pill into quarters or 1/4 the size. A bottle of 30 pills for $5 lasts 3 months and I have most of<br />My hair back after 4 months. Seriously, this lipogaine stuff didnt work for me. and throwing money away with wishful thinking won't fix any problems.

  739. I've been using Lipogaine for several months now, after losing the option of more potent products as a result of a recent FDA crackdown on hair growth product companies. My search for the most potent hair growth products now available led me to Lipogaine, which contains 5% minoxidil, azelaic acid, which helps reduce DHT in the scalp, and retinol, which aids in the absorption of minoxidil. The other ingredients in Lipogaine are nice to have too, like the saw palmetto extract and beta-sitosterol, though what they might be able to do when applied topically is unclear to me.<br /><br />The solution takes a bit of time to dry, but other products have taken much longer for me, especially when there are more active ingredients than just minoxidil. I find that what works best for me is to apply the full 1 ml amount at bedtime, and do half of that in the morning before heading out, which then doesn't give me much of an issue with drying. It's also a bit sticky when dry, but a half application in the morning is easy to work with when dry and even before it's dry. And since I've used so much minoxidil solution by this point of my life, it's better for me to give my scalp a bit of a break during the day at this point. The eyedropper applicator features 4 measurement lines to help me do this.<br /><br />And it does seem to be maintaining the state of my hair growth reasonably well. Again, I'm at a more advanced stage and condition of hair loss than many others may be, so nothing that I know of out there yet can get it all to grow back, but I'm happy with the results from this product.<br /><br />One more thing I'll add in response to the reviewer that suggested blow drying after applying - you do not want to do that. It's important for minoxidil to stay in liquid form on the scalp for a while so that it can be absorbed. Once it's dry, it will be absorbed far less, or not at all.

I have noticed that when using the first bottle, I actually saw an increase of hair falling out. Not sure if that was normal, or I was just paying more attention. Either way, things are better now. Also, make sure you are willing to make this part of your daily routine since you have to apply it 2 times a day.<br /><br />After about 1/2 way through the 2nd bottle, I am beginning to see less thinning, so I really think this product is worth the shot. I also cut out all aspartame from my diet (no more diet cokes, etc) so there is another variable there. I would say this product is worth trying for 2-3 bottles if you are noticing thinning at the crown of your head. Once it dries, it make your hair feel like you are using gel.<br /><br />I will probably use 3 or 4 bottles to 'jump start' my hair re-growth, then switch to the other, less expensive foam brands (Kirkland Foam or other Foam).
