It almost seems as if employees of this company are writing some of these 5 start reviews. One of my thoughts for this was the fact that some of these reviewers have 0 other reviews on Amazon products and claim that the products works wonders. Dont get me wrong, I think its a decent product, I'm just not a little hesitant to believe a reviewer who claims 5 stars, has no other reviews, provides no timeline for how long they have used the products, and is saying \\"best product ever\\", \\"dries fast\\", etc...
  759. I've only been using this for about about a week now, but I'll go ahead and give a little preliminary review:<br /><br />I too did a pretty good bit of online research about where to turn for my hair problems - I've been using Rogaine steadily for a couple of years now and really am not sure if I've ever seen any results from it. When I started using it, I was really only dealing with a receding hairline, but at this point I've got more all-over thinning. I think I may have brought that on myself by using a competing product - I'm not sure if Amazon will let me name it, but it rhymes with Schmectral EMT - contrary to the instructions. It was way too sticky/greasy to use in the morning, so I only applied it at night, and I ended up quitting after about two months because it seemed to be doing more damage than good. So I probably quit mid-shed, and my hair really hasn't recovered from that.<br /><br />Which brings me to Lipogaine: supposedly not sticky/greasy, more effective than Rogaine, has some of the same long-term hair retention as Propecia (which I used for a year but quit because of side effects), etc. A wonder drug, if the reviews are to be believed!<br /><br />Having only used it for a week, I can't speak to how awesome it as at regrowth or retention, but I DO seem to be losing less hair in the sink and the shower. I CAN say that this stuff is NOT as invisible and quick-dry as some reviewers are saying...nothing compares to Rogaine foam for that, including this. It goes on pretty greasy and takes about an hour or an hour and a half to dry in my hair. When it DOES dry, it's fantastic. Adds some thickness and heft to my hair, lets me style it, not greasy whatsoever. But it IS greasy during the drying phase and can leave a powdery whitish residue when it has dried (pretty easy to get rid of, though - you can brush it out or whatever). If you can tough out the greasy drying phase, you're good to go.<br /><br />I haven't seen any noticeable shed yet, but it couldbe that all of my Rogaine use means I might skip that phase. Seems like Lipogaine might be giving me some dark circles under the eyes, but honestly, if that means it's working, I'm willing to deal with that for a while. I plan to update in a few months to see where this leads.<br /><br />EDIT 11/5/2012<br /><br />Alright, so I'm a little over three months in and on my fourth bottle. For whatever reason, the formula in my fourth bottle is noticeably yellower than the previous bottles, but it doesn't seem to have any changed effect or anything. I use the Lipogaine twice a day: .5 mL in the morning and .75 mL at night. I'm using it only on my hairline, which has been slowly receding and thinning for about 6 years or so. I'm also using Regenepure DR and NT Shampoo every other day.<br /><br />Basically, this stuff is legit. I can't say that my hairline has returned or anything, but the Lipogaine HAS grown new hair on my temples. The hairs are currently still very small, but they've been growing (SLOWLY) since I started with the treatment. I have no idea if they'll ever become full-blown normal sized hairs, but new hair is new hair and I'll take it. I was worried about the shedding phase for a little while during months 1 and 2 - seemed like there were some times that a pretty unusual amount of hair was falling out, but that totally stopped about a month ago and I don't really think about it anymore.<br /><br />My plan is to keep up with this for the indefinite future just to see what happens. Although the results so far have been minor, they have been positive, so I'm gonna stick with it.
  760. This is the first review i have written for any product that i have purchased through Amazon. I hope this review is useful to others.<br /><br />I am a woman. Have been using Rogaine 2% since Jan 2010. Then switched to Rogaine 5% since September 2010. 2% worked fine initially but about after about 6 months the effects slowly started to decline so i switched to the 5%. Have been on the 5% for well over 2 years. Its no miracle worker but definitely helped reduce hair loss. It worked as advertised. Did not experience any massive dred sheds upon starting or while using Rogaine 2% or 5% for almost the 3 years i was exclusively on it.<br /><br />After reading so many good reviews on Lipogaine i decided to make a change and give it a shot to see if it will work better than Rogaine. Ordered the 5% and strated using it from Nov 1st 2012. I have bottles of Rogaine liquid so used the Rogaine 5% in the mornings and the Lipogaine 5% in the evenings. Didnt really notice any change for the first 3 and half months. No initial dred shed and that could be because i was already using Rogaine 5%. Nothing good or bad happen other than the fact that the Lipogaine definitely made my scalp more itchy and dirty faster.<br /><br />Going into end of Feb 2013, that's the 4th month, i started noticing increase in hair loss after washing the hair. It accelerated during the course of March 2013, the 5th month of treatment. By the end of March hair was falling in clumps. This continued through April - now well into the 6th month. I've never experienced this while being exlusively on Rogaine. My system definitely doesnt like something about the change to Lipogaine. Whatever it is, is making me shed massively for the past 2 months now. At the end of April, i decided it was enough and stopped using the Lipogaine and stuck to Rogaine liquid twice a day. My scalp is already less itchier and more clean. The shed continues unfortunately. Its been a little over a week since i stopped using the Lipogaine.Am really hoping the shedding stop soon. As most of you know its not a great phase to go through :-)<br /><br />So, that's my experience on Lipogaine. I am happy for those of whom it worked. But i unfortunately did not have a good experience with it. I dont know if the Rogaine kept the sanity and thats why the dreaded reaction took a good 4 months to occur but really really hoping and praying this shed (we are taking clumps of hair folks) thats been going on for almost two months now will stop soon. I used Lipogaine for 6 months including the good 2 months at the tail end even after the shedding started to accelerate. I think that's a long time to keep the sanity and continue using the product. I belive i gave the product a fair shot before giving up.<br /><br />Good luck to everyone!
  761. Although I was fortunate and didn't lose my hair in clumps like some people do, I did notice that my hair was thinning over time and others were noticing it. I am in my 50s and didn't like the look that was developing! After each haircut, I could see the thinning progress further. The gal who cuts my hear had some products to sell, but they were big $$$s. Finally I decided not to sit back and let it happen. I researched available products that contained minoxidil (proven to work) and chose Lipogaine. I wasn't sure it would make a difference for me, but wanted to give it 2-3 months before drawing a conclusion. Now, I am able to look back at my &#34;before&#34; picture and note that my hair is actually becoming thicker and more vigorous. I'm pleased by the results and have ordered more Lipogaine to make sure I am well stocked. It is worth the small monthly expense to slow down and even reverse the process of hair thinning.<br /><br />I like the liquid medication dropper because I can distribute the solution where it is needed most and can then massage it in with my finger tips. I try to avoid getting the hair wet with the solution, but rather get it primarily on the scalp. I let it dry a bit more after the initial application (while brushing my teeth and shaving), then finish with light brushing and manipulation with my fingertips. If I over wet the hair, it requires more manipulation subsequently to spread the hair and get good coverage and fullness.<br /><br />Lipogaine has worked well for me and I am glad that I finally decided to give it a try. I'm pleased that there is a product which worked well for me, was cost effective and didn't have any side effects.

  769. Look man, since you're here, I already know a few things about you. You're losing your hair, and it's bothering you. You're not alone.<br /><br />I started noticing in my early 20s that my hair wasn't what it used to be. standing under bright lights made it pretty clear to me that what once used to be a glorious forest of fluffy goodness was suddenly looking more sad and barren than I previously remembered. Stupidly, I decided to do nothing about it for a couple years, trying to convince myself it was all in my head, or that this was just fate. Something about committing to any sort of medication or product every day for the rest of your life seems like a scary thought at first that you just don't want to deal with. The irony of that logic is that if you opt out, you'll spend more time stressing and staring at your hairline in the bathroom every day than it would take to just put the oil on your head for 30 seconds a day.<br /><br />Eventually I came around and got some lipogaine because it's obviously the best minox on the market (read the label). it's been something like 8 months and I can definitely say things have improved over that time - I feel pretty solid about what's happening on top of my head. More importantly than the results however, is just the peace of mind. Get your minox, get the shampoo, find some finasteride, and if you really want to go nuts pull some strings and get some azelaic acid as well. At that point, it's not even about how much hair you'll have (which will be more than before), but rather the knowledge that you're doing absolutely everything in your power to prevent the hands of time from turning. Once you take the leap you'll find that you can go back to living life again without stressing things that were once out of your control.

These would also leave an oily residue resulting in a shiny scalp. Using this product in conjunction with Regenepure DR (a recommendation from a blogger) I have none of these side effects. My wife made a comment last night that my scalp isn't looking shiny anymore. That could be due to new hairs coming in (light and thin peach fuzz type) and that this doesn't leave scalp and hair feeling oily. Also no redness! I haven't used this without Regenepure, which is suppose to help with redness and inflammation, so I can't say that this on it's own won't cause redness.<br /><br />This product dries really fast, which is nice while getting ready in the morning. I have noticed that there is a residue on my scalp that I can scrape off with my nail. My wife seems to think it's dead skin so I'm not sure. Either way it's not noticeable and dries clear, so that's good. If it dries on the hair, it seems to dry it out or get some weird texture. After it dries I put a little water on my hands and lightly run it across my hair to sort of rinse just the hairs with my head tilted so the water doesn't rinse off my scalp. That has helped with the feel of the hair.<br /><br />After about a month or so of usage I am seeing results. At first it was a few hairs (even where my hairline was) that popped up here and there, sometimes seemingly overnight. After 3 months my wife and I can tell the receding hairs are moving forward towards the first lone hairs that popped up. Looking closely I can really tell the difference, although in my comparison pictures it's not drastically noticeable since they're longer light hairs right now. I'm thinking in a few more months those will get pushed out with thicker hairs.<br /><br />I definitely recommend a try!

  798. I am 67 years old and over the past 15 years (since my hair thinning really became noticeable) I tried Rogaine and the generic sold by Wal-Mart. I attempted to follow the directions of once a day but it caused my scalp to be irritated to the point that I had to dilute it with water to be able to just use it even every other day. After 6 months of use I saw no results and discontinued use of it.<br />With Lipogaine for Men I was delighted to find it did not irritate my scalp - even though it says to use it twice daily. (Which I am doing.) Being realistic I did not expect new hair growth immediately. Things have to happen under the scalp first. For that reason I did not expect appreciable results for 4-6 months. I am pleased to report that after 5 months of use my hair is beginning to thicken in the areas I applied it. Based on what I have experienced with this product thus far I anticipate a solution in 7-9 months - to the point my hair coverage was 20-25 years ago.<br />Update:<br />Originally I began using this product at the first of this year. It is now the end of June, so I have a full 6-month experience with it. (Those who wrote they tried it for awhile and didn't see any difference need to read-on here.) Six-months ago I told my hair stylist that I was using this product. Her comment was that a light massage is very important on each application. I have been doing that. Two weeks ago I was having my hair cut and I asked her if she saw any new growth. (The hair on top of my head has all been pretty-much the same length. About 5-inches. I let it grow that long to make more volume on top to cover the thin areas when I comb it straight back.) She took her comb and pulled a section of the treatment area of my hair straight up (like they do when they are about to cut-off the ends). She then pointed out that I had a crop of new hair that is 2-inches long, all over the treatment area. Although I had been unable to see any new growth when I looked in the mirror at home, I could see it then - very clearly. From what I have been told about the rate of growth of hair, everyone is a bit different, but 1/2\\" per month might be a starting point. If that is true in my case, then the two inches of new growth equates to 4-months of new growth. In other words, there was nothing visible for two months after starting the treatment. Had I quit after 2 months I would have been making a premature decision that it wasn't working. Now I know it surely IS working. Doing the math, again at 1/2\\" per month, it will take about 6 more months for the new crop to catch up with the rest of my hair length. Needless to say, I am very pleased with this product., I could see it then - very clearly. If that is true in my case, then the two inches of new growth equates to 4-months of new growth. In other words, there was nothing visible for two months after starting the treatment.   806. So like most everyone else here, before purchasing this product, I read through all of the reviews trying to filter out the bogus, overly positive, manufacturer-biased reviews from the actual product users who had something to say be it positive or negative. At some point though, I think you just have to trust your gut. In this case, it wasn't difficult for me to decide to try since I've been using the plain 5% minoxidil for years now with only mediocre results. Now to be fair, I would only apply the minoxidil solution once per day, rarely 2x, so I was only successful at preventing the remainder of my hair from falling out completely and not really encouraging new hair growth. However, I'd been losing more hair recently so when I was running out of minoxidil this last time I decided to check other products and ran across Lypogaine.<br /><br />First off, it's extremely expensive compared to the Kirkland and Rogaine products and the Lypogaine bottles are the same size as their competitors (non-foaming) so about 3x as much $$ for one bottle (one month's treatment), but the results speak for themselves.<br /><br />I had a definite balding spot on the crown of my head but was also noticing a lot of thinning in the middle and front towards my forehead. I took a before picture of the balding spot on my crown which I'll post with a 2nd month photo update and a 3rd when I'm finished.<br /><br />I first began to notice a change after about 2 weeks into applying Lypogaine. I've been applying it to the entire top of my head from my hairline above my forehead in front to the balding spot on my crown. The first change I noticed though, appeared as an extremely noticeable thinning in the hairline above my forehead and this really scared me... Was the Lypogaine actually making my hair fall out??? It sure looked like it. But I decided to continue the treatment anyway and give it a full month before making a decision to stop using the product (figured I was losing my hair anyway so what was the risk). Over the next 2 weeks though, I realized that what initially appeared to be a thinning was actually a thickening; I was actually seeing hair regrow along my front hairline above my forehead that had receded years ago so it appeared thin at first but is now thicker, longer and filling in nicely. It appears that I'm reclaiming my old hairline above my forehead and 5% minoxidil never gave me pause to even consider such a development. Granted, my minoxidil use was only 1x per day, but to me, this seems like tangible evidence that something's definitely different with this product.<br /><br />In the other thinning spots on top and at the crown area, much like my front hairline although harder to recognize, I've noticed hundreds of new short, fine hair filling in the spots that have been thinning for years using just the 5% minoxidil. I can't tell yet if these fine hairs will finally grow in as a thick, healthy head of hair or if these fine hairs will fall out just like they have in the past while using 5% minoxidil but my experience so far tells me that this is different since I'm not seeing as much shedding as I've experienced in the past and my hair actually feels stronger and healthier now.<br /><br />Historically, I've had very fine, thin hair and have grown accustomed to seeing hair on my towel after I'd dry it and then again on my hands after I'd apply the minoxidil. Since I've been using this product for about 5 weeks now, my hair feels softer yet stronger when I wash it in the shower and then after I dry it and apply the solution I check my towel and hands and am noticing much less to no hair on them now.<br /><br />A couple of notes: It's difficult to apply this product without getting it into my hair and it makes my hair somewhat stiff and crunchy if I do. If I brush it out, my hair's at least pliable, but then the dried solution creates a fine powder that makes my hair seem dry and stiff. I've found that there's a techniqueto applying it to prevent this, but it seems that the longer my hair is the harder it is to control. If I brush my hair to stand as upright as possible, then lower the dropper between the hair and use just my fingertips in a dabbing motion to carefully work it around the base of the follicles, it works much better than just spreading it around my scalp using the palm of my hand and allowing my hair to become saturated with it. Obviously, the more that gets in my hair the more solution I use and the faster I'll go through a bottle. And since I'm applying it to the entire top of my scalp, I'm already going through it faster than had I just been applying it to my crown area as the directions recommend. I'm already about halfway finished with my second bottle now (about 5 weeks into using the product) and my plan is to continue using it for a total of 3 months and then make an educated decision on whether or not to continue it when I see those results. As of now, I'll be buying more.<br /><br />Also, with all the exercising I do, I'm a big believer in taking supplements, so it must also be noted that as of about a week ago, I started taking [[ASIN:B000BY2N7S NOW Foods Biotin 5000mcg, 120 Vcaps]] and another hair-growth supplement [[ASIN:B0041JIANA Hairomega DHT Dht-blocking Hair Loss Supplement, 90-count Bottle, 45 Day Supply]] once per day (they recommend 2x per day which I'll gradually work up to over a 2-3 week period). Take these into consideration when evaluating my account of the product moving forward as it could potentially be a result of those supplements, although still used in conjunction with Lypogaine.<br /><br />So far, I'm very pleased with the product and will continue to use it even if it costs me $60 per month to keep up the regimen provided the results continue to impress. For this review, I gave Lypogaine five stars for the efficacy of the product but subtracted one star combined for both the product price and stiffness it causes when it getsin my hair.<br /><br />I will continue to update this review over the next 2 months and will post before and after photos for people to see my results and decide for themselves.

It is important to cover the entire affected area. Take 10,000 mcg of Biotin by mouth and also take 540mg of Saw Palmetto (whole berry) by mouth.<br /><br />Every night: Take one or two 540mg Saw Palmetto capsules(whole berry) and apply 1 ml of lipogaine to scalp and massage in.<br /><br />Twice a week: before shampooing with Pura d'or-- shampoo with T/Sal therapuetic shampoo. T/Sal will dissolve dead skin and other impurities from your scalp leaving unblocked hair follicles. This allows better absorption of Lipogaine and the active ingredients in Pura d'or shampoo.<br /><br />Once a week: apply Rene Furterer RF 80 serum (available on Amazon)to scalp after shampooing and allowing scalp to dry.This seemed to really stimulate hair growth!<br /><br />Be patient!   826. ***UPDATE*** It has been 4 months since my review and a little less than 2 years since I first started using Lipogaine. Unfortunately, I can no longer stand by this product like I used to. In the last few months I have noticed a failure of the product to maintain my hair and a quickening of the rate of my hairloss. In fact, I believe I am now losing hair in the crown area as well, which was completely full before recently. After a relative pointed out to me the hairloss on my crown, I also examined it myself for a couple of days and certainly saw more scalp there than what I'd seen normally before. So I decided that I wasn't going to wait like last time and instead initiate minoxidil treatment immediately to mitigate DHT damages in the crown area as soon as possible. Yes, I am using lipogaine still for all of my head, and that is mainly because that's what I had on hand and it is very convenient because it dries fast. But I think that now it is as good as any other minoxidil product out there, if not worse, since it is overpriced for what it does. It pains me to say this because this product did miracles for me with the old formula. Literally, when I first started use, it miraculously grew hair for me before my very eyes, and not just any hair, but thick full dark hair. 3 months later, when they switched formulas due to pressure from big pharma (as rumor has it), lipogaine lost a lot of power as a product. It no longer did what it used to. But I continued using it because at least it was still able to maintain the hair I had on my head and I kept using it because this thing dries fast. But these past few months, lipogaine hasn't even been able to maintain my hair. My routine hasn't changed, except for maybe a different sleep pattern. I seriously doubt that is what triggered this new onslaught of DHT. My hypothesis is that since I've hit 25, my body has produced more 5 Alpha Reductase enzymes and that is taking more of my testosterone and changing it to thisdreadful DHT compound, which is starving my hair follicles. At this point DHT is winning this battle and I am not happy about it. Lipogaine isn't strong enough. I did also mention in the review below that I was using azelaic acid cream to replace this ingredient since it was removed from the old formula, but that unfortunately has done nothing for me. I've rubbed a bit of the azelaic acid cream on my head at night after applying the lipogaine minoxidil solution and letting it dry. I haven't been very regular with it, but only because I saw no real improvements when I was using it regularly. Apparently, it's not as good as it was when Lipogaine had it mixed in their solution. Or maybe I'm doing it wrong, I don't know. Lipogaine removed it so now I have to make conjectures from my own experiences. I also said that I was going to buy that Pura D'or shampoo with argan oil after my Vita Tres biotin shampoo was finished. I'm still going to do that because the argain oil I bought in bottle form from Pura D'or makes my hair feel soft, shiny, and look healthy. I doubt it'll do anything meaningful about my DHT problem, but at least it contains all the right stuff that you usally like to see when you're trying to fight hairloss. I will definitely put up a review of that product as well when I finish my first bottle. I was sent a Lipogaine shampoo to try out also. I will open that tomorrow. I will post a review when the bottle is finished, which I anticipate won't be for another 3 months. Other than that, at this point I am just hoping that the science on this continues to advance and that big pharma doesn't strangle anything that threatens their rogaine and other big pharma products' profits. There are some new products out there on amazon with seemingly high ratings, though I'm not sure which ones are legit and which ones have fake reviews, and I'm not willing to shell out $60 a month to try them out. I'm hoping for something effective and affordable. Until a fewmonths ago that was Lipogaine. Now? Who knows... TL;DR: Lipogaine was a godsend when it had Azelaic Acid, but when they changed their formula in Summer 2013, the product became pretty average. It was at least still able to maintain the hair on my head. Lately, however, ever since hitting 25, my hairloss has sped up (probably due to increased 5 alpha reductase enzyme production in my body) and Lipogaine hasn't been particularly effective in holding it back. Thus I can no longer make the claim that \\"it stopped my hairloss\\". As far as I'm concerned, to me now it is of equal value to other generic minoxidil products, except it dries faster and is more expensive. I will mostly likely buy Kirkland and use that at night to cut down on my Lipogaine expenses now. ***ORIGINAL REVIEW*** I have been using this product for over 1.5 years. It has worked for me. I wouldn't dish out $25 every month if I did not believe it was the single most important reason why I've been able to maintain hair in some areas of my head and grow it back in others. The biggest regret I have is not starting sooner because I would have been able to stop more hair from falling out. A little bit about me... I am 25 years old and am a Norwood 2 on the scale. My hairloss started very early at age 16, but progressed slowly. I didn't do anything about it until the age of 23, when I could no longer hide the bald spots on the left and right top corners of my head. I then did some research and bought my first bottle of Lipogaine. It's been one of the smartest investments I've ever made. It works for me. It has largely stopped my hairloss on the left and right front corners of my head and it has restored all of my hair in the temple area. I recommend buying this product and trying it out for a minimum of 3-4 months to see if it will work for you too. THE LONG VERSION If you want to know more about my experiences and observations about this product in the 1.5 years I've used it, keep reading. Iwill write about some tips and observations about this product and other products I currently use. OBSERVATION #1. The product WORKS, but has limitations. Is it able to STOP hair loss? For me, ABSOLUTELY YES (but every person is different). Is it able to GROW NEW hair? Well...KINDA. What I mean is that, in my experience, it can grow hair if the hair follicle in your scalp has not completely died out. In other words, if you have a completely bald spot that has been that way for the last two years, chances are that you will not get new hair growth there if you buy this product. The product inhibits harmful DHT hormones, thus allowing the existing follicles to grow mostly uninhibited. But it does NOT plant new follicles in your head. It is NO miracle cure, at least in my experience. What this treatment did for me is that all the hair that was ever going to grow back, grew within the first 3 to 4 months of using the product. After that, no new hair was growing. All the hair in my left and right temple area came back. 50% of the hair in my top right corner also came back. I wasn't so lucky for the top left corner. That's where I had the most dead follicles so only 10-15% of this hair grew back. But at least the remaining follicles grew thicker and stronger. I am happy with the results because at last now I can hide my bald spots in this area again. I SHOULD HAVE started this treatment as early as possible in order to prevent DHT damage to follicles that was irreversible before they died out. That is why here is my tip number one for you. TIP #1: If you have already decided that you want to go down the minoxidil path for the rest of your life, start using this product ASAP, as early as possible. The longer you wait, the more damaged your follicles will become by DHT, until at one point the follicle will completely die out. When that happens, all the Minoxidil in the world won't help you short of a hair transplant in that area of your head. So get on some sort of DHTblocker immediately if you don't want to lose any more hair. I recommend using Lipogaine, but there's much cheaper options on Amazon. Are they as effective? I don't know. Are they as cleanly applied? No, Lipogaine has an advantage there if you have a busy schedule. OBSERVATION #2: When you first start using the product, you will experience heavy shedding of hair. It will seem like the product is balding you even more. This is NORMAL and will go on for 2 to 3 weeks, if memory serves me right. It is a sign that the product is WORKING, so don't freak out! As far as I understand, the reason why this happens is because the product speeds up the life cycle of some of these hairs, making them fall out initially. Don't worry, they will soon be replaced by thicker versions of themselves. Stick with the product for at least 3 months before you chuck it completely saying that it doesn't work. TIP #2: Use the product DAILY, twice a day. I use it once in the morning when I wake up, and once at night before going to bed. I try to space out at least 8 hours between the two applications. Missing one application a day isn't the end of the world (and I have missed one on many days), but you want to have the product be as effective as possible. I mean you're spending $25 a month plus shipping for this little bottle. So try to stick to a set schedule. And be strict about it. To apply, use the dropper to pull out about 1.0 mL of Lipogaine solution and then apply directly to the scalp where you want your hair to stop falling and new hair to come out. Be sure your head is clean and dry. You want the liquid to seep into your scalp. Applying the product is a learning process, but soon you will get the hang of it. I put the dropper directly on the scalp so that as little as possible gets on my actual hair. You want your scalp, not your hair, to absorb this. If it starts to trickle down your forehead, just use a finger to gently rub it into the scalp. You want your scalp to be clean and dry for better absorption. OBSERVATION #3: When you apply the product, you have about a 5 minute window until it dries, depending on how wet or dry your scalp is. The drier your head, the faster the product dries, which is good. You want a dry head of hair before applying the product so as to avoid the product climbing up on your hair follicles because it is being wasted there. Sometimes I will apply a little smidge to my actual hair because the product also acts as a gel and dries your hair in place. That's a real plus so you don't have to buy other harmful gel products, which I do not recommend that you use at all, especially if you have hairloss. Drop them right now and buy this product instead. This \\"gelling\\" ability is an advantage Lipogaine has over other minoxidil products. TIP #3: Try to shower the product off every day after it has already dried on your scalp and been there for many hours. It has already served its purpose and you want to have the pores on your scalp be open and clean again for the new application of Lipogaine. I shower every morning. In my experience, if you just keep applying layer after layer of Lipogaine to the scalp without showering for more than two days, you will see that the product will start to flake off from your scalp and it will look like you have dandruff on your hair. It will also become kind of whitish on your hair and make you look like you have grey hair. At this point, you definitely need to go take a shower. OBSERVATION #4: About 4 months into my treatment I was experiencing faster hairloss and the gains seemed to be reversing slowly. When I dug deeper into it, it seemed like the company had changed the formula. The story is the FCC prohibited them from using azelaic acid. Lipogaine denies this, but when you compare the product labeling one key ingredient *Azelaic Acid* became \\"DHT blocker proprietary blend with Azetinol\\", and there's no denying that. Many people claim it's basically still the same thing. I'm not so sure, but continued use with this new version has at least been able to maintain existing hair follicles for me and I have seen some new growth in the form of thin short hair follicles but I do not believe they will grow into full mature healthy hairs. But if I had to choose, I'd want the old formula back. TIP #4: Use Lipogaine Minoxidil solution in conjunction with other products. When you do this, you fight DHT in more ways and have a better chance of recuperating your lost hair. I will list here what I use in order of priority from most potent and important to least important: A) MINOXIDIL Solution. I recommend Lipogaine. Yes, this is the most important weapon in my arsenal of fighting hairloss. Even if you don't have the money for Lipogaine, then at least buy some sort of minoxidil solution. The longer you wait, the worse it gets for you. Each bottle lasts 1 month used twice daily. Each bottle costs $25 for a total of $300 yearly. B) KETOCONAZOLE Shampoo. An absolute must have for anyone with hairloss would be a ketoconazole shampoo. Ketoconazole is the active ingredient in shampoos that fight against dandruff, but it has been clinically proven to effectively fight against hairloss. For me it is very important to use a keto shampoo. I have used Lipogaine Big 3, Regenpure, and a few others. I recommend these two, but there's other options on Amazon. They each cost about $25 plus shipping and generally last me about 3 months per bottle if used every morning in the shower. Yearly costs will run you $100. C) AZELAIC ACID cream. Since Lipogaine no longer has azelaic acid in this form, I have bought the cream myself from eBay. Just search on eBay for it and you will see several options. I am using Skinoren 20%, but there's other options. I do believe it makes a difference. I recently started (2 months ago) using it on my head and have seen improvement on areas of my head that seemed to be hopelessly gone forever. There's short thin follicle sprouts in these areas. They probably won't ever grow to full mature hairs, but this is evidence that Azelaic Acid blocks DHT on that part of the head where I need it to work. Azelaic Acid is actually an acne cream. You can buy the cream for maybe $20 and it can last about 4 months. I use it once every night, because it does dry your scalp, so I leave it overnight and shower it off in the morning. Then I don't apply it again until the next night. Yearly costs are about $60 + shipping. D) MICRONEEDLE ROLLER. You can buy one from amazon for like $7 and it can last you up to a year. The one I bought has 1.5mm 540 needles. Why is it important to buy it? Well, because you can roll it on your scalp and create little microscopic incisions, which can make the lipogaine and azelaic acid better able to penetrate the skin and get deep in there to block the DHT under your scalp. I don't recommend using more than once a day, but definitely more than 3 times a week, in my opinion. I spray alcohol to clean mine after each use. There's an added bonus to the microneedle roller, which is that you can use it over your wrinkles to stimulate collagen production on your skin. Check out youtube videos about it. If you buy two a year, it will cost you about $15 total. E) ARGAN OIL (Pura D'Or). I feel like this product has helped nourish my hair more than just cosmetically. Certainly if you use azelaic acid on your scalp, it can dry the scalp. So I use this product every morning after I shower. After drying my head, I put this on first, let dry for about 5 minutes and then apply Lipogaine. This product will last at least 4 months and costs about $20 on Amazon. Actually, when this bottle ends, I am considering buying the shampoo form of it and not buying the BIOTIN shampoo that I use in the shower addition to the Ketoconazole shampoo. But if you do want to buy this product (it has great amazon reviews), it will run you back about $60/year. F) BIOTIN shampoo. I use the Nexxus VitaTres Biotin ONE and it makes my hair fuller and gives it biotin, which is essential to the health of your hair. I use two shampoos in the shower, the ketoconazole shampoo (Lipogaine or Regenpure) and the Biotin shampoo. As I said above, I'm thinking of swapping the biotin shampoo for the Pura D'Or argan oil shampoo. The Pura D'or shampoo is a bit more expensive, but then again I won't have to buy the additional argan oil bottle. So I'd be spending less in total. But if you want a volumizing to make your hair look fuller, consider this one. If you get the pack of two deal at $30, that's all you need to spend for a full year, since each bottle lasts me about 6 months. G) OTHER PRODUCTS. As you can see, there's six products that I use on my hair listed in order of importance. I don't necessarily think that you can't stop your hairloss unless you use all of them. If you're on a budget, just buy a cheaper minoxidil product and a ketoconazole shampoo and that alone will help considerably. But if you're able to spend more, then consider these other products which I have tried and which have given me results to various degrees. They're all well-regarded products on amazon. I have also bought biotin pills, but found that, apart from making my nails stronger, they didn't have any visible effects on my hair, which is also why I will probably not buy the Biotin shampoo after I'm done with it and go straight for the Pura D'Or shampoo. Some people choose to take more drastic actions and ingest more potent pills like FINASTERIDE instead of sticking to the topical treatments like me. After doing some research on FINASTERIDE and reading that it could lead to impotence, I decided to steer clear of it. There is only a small chance that it will have this side-effect, but I am not willing to take that risk since my manhood is more important than my hairloss. Each person should do their own research on finasteride and all these other products I've listed above before making their own choices. TIP #5: Now, since you have a listing of all my products I will tell you my daily routine. Basically, I shower in the morning, first applying the KETOCONAZOLE shampoo and leaving it for about 4-5 minutes on my head while in the shower. I usually brush my teeth or scrub my body in the meantime. Then I rinse the Ketoconazole off and apply the BIOTIN shampoo. As I said above, I will probably swap this with the Pura D'Or in the future. I use this second shampoo as a conditioner. Leave it on for 2-3 minutes and then rinse your hair out completely. After jumping out of the shower and drying my hair as well as I can, I apply the ARGAN Oil. I leave that for five minutes and then apply the LIPOGAINE and quickly style my hair. At night, if my hair is stuck in place due to the minoxidil, I will wet my hair and gently rinse it off. After drying it, I take my microneedle roller, sterilize it in alcohol, rinse, and then apply the microneedle to my scalp in a diagonal fashion. I sterilize it again after I'm finished with it and then apply LIPOGAINE. After 3-5 minutes I will take just a little smidge of AZELAIC acid cream and rub it into my scalp. I put the azelaic acid second on my scalp because I don't want my pores to be blocked by it. OBSERVATION #5: Before you buy this product you have to think long and hard. This is something that once you start, you have to stick with it for life or at least until science and medicine find a better solution to hairloss. If you stop using it, all the hair you were able to save during all this time will eventually fall off. That's a waste of money and money is important factor here. The yearly costs for this hair treatment come out to be around a minimum of $300 plus shipping at $25 a month per bottle of Lipogaine, and this is just for the minoxidil treatment alone! You gotta think long and hard if that's something you can afford. And if you want to buy the other products I suggested, costs will run you back $600 every year. This is definitely something you want to keep in mind. I always buy products in bulk so as to get free shipping from amazon. CONCLUSION: I have been using the product for over 1.5 YEARS. The product WORKS, although it is more effective at STOPPING hairloss than REVERSING it. Hairloss for me has almost completely stopped and I was also lucky to experience some new growth, but for areas where I had been bald a long time, there were no results, although some of these areas do show thin hairs about a quarter of an inch long, but I do not believe that they will grow to mature hairs. You will experience heavy shedding INITIALLY. This is NORMAL and it means the product is working. This hair will come back soon in a fuller and stronger form. Stick with the product for at least THREE MONTHS before saying it doesn't work. Apply Lipogaine DAILY to a DRY scalp, 1 mL TWICE A DAY with at least 8 HOURS apart between each application. Shampoo your hair daily. I would encourage you to use the OTHER products I mentioned above so that you have a better chance of fighting DHT, stopping hairloss, and getting back new hairs. The product dries fast and can serve as a type of GEL. Do not use other styling products on your hair. Think long and had if this is something that you want to go into. Once you start the treatment, you CANNOT STOP or the hair that you gained while on the treatment will fall off. COSTS per year for this product are at least $300. Try to get deals for FREE SHIPPING by buying in bulk. For me the costs are totally worth the head of hair that I have now and I do not regret going down this path. My biggest regret is not starting SOONER because I could have saved more hair follicles before they died out completely. Hope this review helps you make your own decision. GOOD LUCK with your hair loss.

  835. I have used Rogain, Rogain foam, and Provilus. Now Lipogaine. Used all of these for 8 months or longer.<br /><br />Rogaine works, but not that great. It takes the longest to dry. Only difference.<br /><br />Provilus. Works perhaps a tiny bit better than Rogaine, but not much. Dries a lot faster, but plan on at least an hour. Not much improvement.<br /><br />Lipogaine. THIS STUFF WORKS. At first I my hair thinned a little, but I expected this and stuck with it. I have used this now for about 6 months, less than the others, but have seen dramatic improvements. I have male pattern baldness caused by DHT (testosterone converted to dihydrotestosterone) which is the main cause of my hair loss. I have a high testosterone level. My hair loss is in the front mostly, on the crown of the head. A receding hair line if you will. It will not grow all your hair back, but it has grown quite a bit, and works far better than anything I have used. I am very skeptical of all pharmaceutical products, but much to my surprise, this one actually does what it says it will do. Don't expect a full head of hair, but expect somewhat significant regrowth. Be wary of pills like finasteride (Propecia). It caused sexual dysfunction in me long after I took it. It took me two years to get mostly back to normal. Never thought a pill could do something that serious in only 5 months of taking it, and it doesn't do it to everyone, but it did that to me. Me testosterone level dropped from 700 to 150 while on it causing tiredness, lack of energy, inability to ejaculate, loss of libido and sensitivity.<br /><br />Lipogaine dries in about an hour to two hours and has caused no itching or flakiness much to my surprise. Love it.

Before I started using it my hair was thinning rapidly and the hair on the top of my head had virtually stopped growing. I had gone from a hair cut every 2 weeks to one every month (and even then only because the hair on the side/back of my head needed cutting not the top!).<br /><br /> So I started using this Lipogaine thing. I used the recommended 1ml (handy dropper) and pretty much applied it all over the top of my head. Sometimes I would use a little more than 1ml. I have been doing this at least once a day for about a month. In that time I have noticed a significant increase in the rate of growth. The hair on top my head is growing rapidly and I am back to my every 2-3 week hair cut. BUT their is no NEW growth (at least as far as I can tell). My hair is still very thin and I have not gained back what I lost. I don't know if my results will change if I continue using this product, but I plan on using it indefinitely.<br /><br />In summary, this product is a stop loss measure. You might not get new growth but it will help you keep what you have (I just wish I had started earlier).

But I couldn't. I wonder if anyone else has similar experience as mine?

  888. I have used Lipogaine for two years now. I first began using it in July of 2013 and began noticing effects after about three weeks. My hair began to fall out. BUT this is a GOOD thing. It is a good indication that the product is working. Once the follicles are stimulated enough to start regrowing hair, they will push the thinner and dead strand out in favor of a newer thicker strand growing underneath. I'd say after 2 months (looking at before and after pictures) my hair started to regrow. Maximum effect was probably visible after 3 to 4 months. Lipogaine definitely worked to a degree. Its not a solution to hair loss but certainly can regrow hair a little bit and halt further hair loss. The beneficial effects will start to taper off though I think after about a year, which may suggest that cycles of treatment may be the most optimal way to use it.

You got to the right place.<br /><br />The first thing I found was that minoxidil works. I don't care how or why, it works. The second important thing I found was that using minoxidil wasn't enough, there has to be some sort of DHT blocking on your part so the new hairs don't get \\"attacked\\" and can grow strong and easy. Propecia wasn't an option for me, cause I don't even want to risk the sexual side effects, and most other solutions are pricey or just seem shady.<br /><br />This is where Lipogaine comes in. It blocks DHT, it has minoxidil, it even has azelaic acid which suppossedly enhances the minoxidil intake of your scalp. I was as sceptical as the next guy but I KNEW I had to fight my hair loss or forever regret my lack of action.<br /><br />At first my hair kept falling, it didn't stop that, it even increases shedding in some people. I literally have showers where I don't lose any single hair, compared to before where I lost like 20 minimum. Also, my hair looks stronger, thicker and more full of life now.<br /><br />After I began balding I didn't get a hair cut for like 8 months cause I didn't want anyone to notice. We shall forever keep at it and forever win :D.<br /><br />KUDOS!<br /><br />**UPDATE**<br /><br />Guys as of a while ago, Lipogaine no longer contains Azelaic Acid. I must say the product still works but it doesn't work as effectively as it used to. I still think it's the best minoxidil available but I don't know if it's as effective blocking DHT as it once was.<br /><br />I wrote a letter to Lipogaine urging them to return the azelaic acid to Lipogaine's formula. It'd be awesome if you guys could do the same.<br /><br />Just to clear everything up, my original review STILL stands true to me. Not an instant full thick head of hair, but more than the increasingly disappointing amount I had previous. I started using Lipogaine with a completely buzz-cut head (the buzzcut pushed me, seeing so much scalp) and within finishing the first bottole, I noticed small, shorter hairs among the regular length hairs, particularly in areas that were worse off than the rest. Overall, so far, it's not a miracle drug. I still have thin hair, and scalp can still be seen with enough light. BUT, the amount of scalp has definitely reduced and my hairline seems to have ceased it's recession. Given a full year of use and beyond, I imagine this product may help in retaining hair on my head at least until I hit my 30's. Hopefully beyond that.<br /><br />Few notes:<br />- Product dries in the hair, and acts as a weak hair spray if you have long enough hair...helps in the instance of styling your hair without using product that would make your scalp more visible.<br />- Longer hair will make it harder to spread the product's recommended value to the areas you'd like, so keep it short unless you want to be methodical.<br />- It's $25 dollars, and lasts a month. Far cheaper than the competition, and thus far? Seems to actually work.<br />- Be patient, nothing will be instantaneous. Like keeping in shape, your body needs proper diet in addition to proper exercise. Add biotin pills to your breakfast or dinner, attacking a problem from multiple angles always helps to ensure more success.<br /><br />Good luck, and I hope other people's hair reacts as well or better to this product!
  902. I apply this product only to my hair line with a soft and small brush and after 2 months of usage I started seeing noticeable growth. It's not greasy but I noticed that if I don't brush it or rub it in, it get a bit hard and flaky.
  903. So It has been a little over a year since I started using Lipogaine. This is my one and only brand of minoxidil, and I want to share my honest experience with this product.<br /><br />Let me first start off by saying, if you're beginning to notice that you're losing your hair, you need to start some hair loss regimen ASAP! Time is the enemy of healthy hair, and the loss won't stop on its own. With that being said, Minoxidil--the active ingredient in Lipogaine-- is the most popular hair loss treatment on the market. Minoxidil acts as a vasodilator, which means that it increases the blood flow to the tissue in the scalp. This increase of blood flow helps to keep dying hair follicles alive and healthy for longer than they would be on their own.<br /><br />If you do any search for minoxidil on Amazon, you'll see tons of different brands. Expensive, and inexpensive. The reason I went for Lipogaine initially is that the formula is a combination of several different ingredients. And it is well-known in the hair loss community that using minoxidil in combination with other supplements and treatments is much more effective than minoxidil alone. So Lipogaine's addition of saw palmetto, biotin and fatty acids all work in conjunction with minoxidil to make it more effective than the generic minox-only brands.<br /><br />In the year that I have been using Lipogaine, I've managed to keep my hairline where it is, and the loss has slowed considerably. Not to mention, I've only been using this once a day, instead of the recommended twice per day, which speaks to how effective this stuff actually is. Lipogaine isn't the cheapest brand of minoxidil on the market, but I truly believe it has the best combination of ingredients of any brand.<br /><br />And as a side note to any newcomers to the hair loss game, combining Lipogaine with oral supplements such as biotin, gelatin, silica or even Propecia, will help it work its magic even better. Also, I gave this product 4 out of 5 stars due to the fact that it does give me a very flaky scalp. Be sure to use a dandruff shampoo and a very moisturizing conditioner, and you'll be fine. Good luck!a very flaky scalp. Be sure to use a dandruff shampoo and a very moisturizing conditioner, and you'll be fine. Good luck!

  925. Firstly let me say Alopecia (hair loss) is a medical condition that has many different types. [...] has some good pics. Male pattern baldness (Androgenetic alopecia) and Female pattern baldness are the only ones for which Minoxidil was tested against and approved for. What I want to say here is like any medical condition you should see a Doctor and get it properly diagnosed before at the very least wasting you money.<br /><br />--<br /><br />With that said, my own condition is Diffused Hair Loss. I started noticing it a few years ago on one side of the crown, then the other, and now the top from the forehead back to the vertex. Not bald but thinning and the hair isn't growing in. I probably should have addressed the issue sooner but wanted to now before I go completely bald.<br /><br />---<br /><br />Lipogaine is one of these new generation of hair loss products which combines DHT blocking with the hair growing element in addition to some vitamins.<br />This as opposed to you buying separate products (typically Finasteride is used in conjunction w/Minoxidil when treating Male Pattern Baldness).<br /><br />The problem here is there is only one (1) clinical study showing the effectiveness of Saw palmetto in blocking and/or reducing DHT levels regarding hair loss. That study only had 10 males. Hardly a reasonable sample to draw any scientific conclusions. This might explain why there aren't any medical guidelines published on the dosage required to achieve that aim.<br /><br />Likewise w/Azelaic Acid. Only one small study was done to test it's effectiveness at blocking/reducing DHT levels regarding hair loss and that was done in the lab on rats. No human clinical study has been done that I could find.<br /><br />-----<br /><br />Hang in there as I'm not going to go down the entire ingredient list. The vitamins (like Biotin) are well known for \\"aiding\\" in strong healthy hair but more to the point. When you extract out the DHT blocking claims I just can't justify the cost of this product over a generic brand of Minoxidil.<br /><br />Especially when there are some that sell 3 or 6 months worth for the same price. And you'll need that much time at least to see any if at all improvement in your condition. That's just the way Minoxidil works. Also remember once you start using Minoxidil your on it for life or you will lose any hair that's grown within several months. The costs can quickly add up.<br /><br />----<br /><br />The bottle I ordered didn't even make it through two weeks. I just ran out and got the generic stuff from the local Pharmacy until my appt comes up w/my Dermatologist. So I can't report as to whether or not any hair did grow in.<br /><br />Maybe if you have one small spot to treat it might last you, but using it twice a day as directed on the amount of real estate I had to cover it was a no go.<br /><br />I didn't experience any adverse side effects (itching, bumps, redness, that sort of thing). I'm not going to whine about it running down my face, back of my neck and such (water always seeks the lowest point,, get it).<br /><br />----<br /><br />Summing it up folks you will notice a trend with all these products for stopping hair loss and/or regrowing hair. Small 2 ounce bottles whose active ingredient (Minoxidil) takes several months to show any signs of improvement. At $25.00 a bottle x 2 per month that's at least $150.00 + tax and shipping to try it for 3 months. If you've experienced side effects with other similar products and need/want to try something different then by all means.<br /><br />Times are hard and my pocket is lean, I need make the maximum effectiveness of any purchase I make these days. Lipogaine needs to come down in price a bit as there isn't any worthwhile reason to pay the premium they're charging IMHO.<br /><br />Greg

  938. Havent seen improvement in my hair grouth and I've been using it for more than two years. I keep using it because it keeps my hair calm and dont need to use other hair products to style them.
  939. Excellent product for thin hair. I've tried all kinds of products, but with Lipogaine, I can see the results already since day one . Took 3 months to see my hair back so give it a try ... Sincerely , Carlin
  940. I think it does work albeit it seems to take quite a bit of time. so far its the best product I h.ave found
  941. Very good product. I did not get a lot of 'hair regrowth&#34; but it did stop my hair from falling out. I started using this product a few years ago and I am confident that I would be fully bald if it wasn't for this.
  942. I am in my 50's and started to notice a tiny vertex on the top of my head back in 2009. I've always had a sense of pride in the thickness of my hair and this really scared me. I did my research on google and like everyone else I settled on the product that probably advertised the most and made the most claims. I purchased a half year supply of Provillus. The first three months of my treatment were actually agonizing with my scalp itching to the point where I bled from scratching. I eventually became immune to the irritation but not much had changed and my vertex had grown. I eventually tried Rogaine brand from CVS since the cost was much less. I would rotate between a CVS generic brand and Rogaine but still little was changing on my head. Earlier in 2012 someone suggested Lipogaine on a blog for people losing hair.I have to admit, the product is expensive but it has greater effect than the other three products I used. I would not assert I have my full flock of hair back but it has made my hair fuller and has prevented further hair loss. With the thicker hair I can comb to cover the vertex portion of my head. I will continue to buy this product until someone finds a cure or until my head just becomes bald by the natural process of aging. Having been a user of the big name brands, I wish I had found this product back in 2009.
  943. I was having some skin irritation with Rogaine, so I tried this. Caused even more irritation than the Rogaine. If you are prone to irritation, don't recommend.
  944. Works pretty good, especially in the beginning. Been using for a couple months and this is much better than the full Nioxin treatment system 2 (shampoo, conditioner, scalp therapy, foam) which I used prior. The results seem to have plateued a bit however but still works good and will continue to use for frontal receding hairline
  945. I have been using Lipogaine for the last seven months and I have seen impressive results. My hair was thinning noticeably, especially around the hairline. I am in my forties and have taken pride in having full thick hair. Before considering transplants, I tried Lipogaine. All I can say is I went from seeing more scalp than hair in certain places to now seeing it in reverse. I no longer feel insecure about my hair, and see no need to see a hair transplant doctor. I will keep on using Lipogaine as long as I care about my hairline.
  946. I waited a *long* time to review this product and hesitated to write anything at all. I used this product as advertised for three months and it just did not work for me. It was, in fact, extremely unpleasant to use and I finished my usage with less hair than I started with.<br /><br />The idea with this product is that the active ingredient dilates the hair follicles, causing some initial hair loss, but eventually causing thicker hair to grow back in its place.<br /><br />Personally, I only experienced the first half of this cycle (hair loss), with not even the slightest hint of new hair growth after three months. My hairloss is near the front of my hairline, which might have had something to do with this. Many of these hair regrowth products tend to work better on the crown than the front of the hairline. I knew this before using the product, I just figured it was worth a shot. Unfortunately it just didn't work out for me.<br /><br />That said, I am giving this product three stars because I have faith that it might work for some people. I cannot recommend this product for front-hairline hairloss, but if you are losing hair on the crown of your head, it would probably work for you.<br /><br />One thing I must mention about this product is that it's very unpleasant to use. The ingredients in it irritated my scalp and made it itch incessantly for the first few weeks. The itching was so bad I almost stopped using it during the first bottle, but managed to get through it. It also weighs your hair down, making it look greasy and wet - which is the exact opposite of what you want if you have thinning hair. Let me be clear, I hated using this stuff, but if you find you get results from it, it could be worth it for you.
